comment: Used to have older antenna and was barely getting couple channels and not clear connectionsAfter installing this antenna
Easy out of box install and setup. Excellent pic quality
Impressed! Easy to set upMany channels and picture quality is good.
Super easy to connect and awesome signal reception even downstairs where I did connected.
My new HDTV antenna works perfectly! I purchased this product so that my family can enjoy all of our local channels, and the antenna works great. Easy set up and mounting.
Just ordered 2 units, and more than satisfied, the picture is clean and stable.The quality of the performance is amazing, it will save me more than $ 1200 per year. I recommend to everyone!
I bought this for a friend
just bought for my fifth TV in the garage, and more than satisfied, think about replacing the other 4 boxes with this antenna, the picture quality is impressive.Thanks for the quality product.
Works great! Picked up 28 channels. Glad I cut the cord on cable. This was easy to install and once we mount our TV, it will be totally hidden.
I highly suggest buying this it’s a great product when I scan channels on my television with this I was receiving 33 channels and I don’t have cable so those are all free!!!

Mounted 32” tv on patio wall.... wondering how I’m going to get any channels without paying for another overpriced Frontier box.Did the research on digital antennas and rolled the dice on this model based on ALL positive reviews and price.

The antenna is great. I have around 60 channels now. The set up was easy and quick. I did it myself in about 10 minutes. I love it and would recommend it to everyone! FYI I live in Central Florida area.

Just received my antenna and could not be more pleased. Within 10 minutes I had antenna hooked up and watching tv. I am getting over 30 channels and am cutting cable.I would recommend this antenna to anyone
It was easy to install, as soon as I plugged it in it gave me about 10 channels, then I run the channel tuning on the TV and got about 69 channels. Not bad for the price, it gets some HD locals.

I just received my HDTV antenna today 2/4/20. It was super easy to set up and without placing it near a window I received tv channels. The quality of the images was HD quality and I couldn’t believe my eyes. I decided to place it in a spare room because that room has a window but I didn’t place it near the window and yet I was still able to get HD TV. I can’t believe I waited this long to get one of these antennas. From what I hear from friends my antenna is far better than theirs. They tell me their antenna have to be placed in a window.I’m very happy with your product because of the quality of the pictures and easy setup.

I bought this Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna last week. Now there are 54 clear & stable digital channels, and the favorite kid channel is back. We love it, thanks for this great product.BTW, I live near the foothill of Los Gatos, CA, the signal is not good, I have 2 other normal antennas, with them, I can only get about 10 channels and they are not stable, my kids complained a lot. but with this antenna, it amplifies the signal and we get images with very good quality.
My new HDTV antenna works perfectly! I purchased this product so that my family can enjoy all of our local channels, and the antenna works great. Easy set up and mounting.
Lo estoy utilizando en mi cuarto y es la mejor antena y seve que es de muy buena calidad.
It works great! Looks great! We love it! We have a 4K tv!

I previously bought a cheap Walmart version of this and it couldn’t pull my local abc channel. That took 20 minutes just to pull 26 channels Smh. I love on an second floor apartment building and my internal one sucks. This one from amazon took about 5 whole minutes to set up and pulled 43 channels. I splurged a tad more than the cheapo Walmart one but it was well worth it.

Was delivered yesterday, spent 10minutes this morning connecting to new TCL tv, let it scan for air channels, and shazam, tv...I have it strung over closet desk door, not optimal, and the reception, signal strength and picture clarity are incredible.
This antenna worked great. This was purchased to replace one that was a piece of junk and was 3 times the price!We get about 55 channels and are very pleased! We have cut the cable!!!
Works as said
This was the forth indoor antenna I tried . I sent the first three back. Got this one from Amazon and it works really good. Just what I was looking for . I recommend it . It works.

This is a great little purchase.  I originally purchased this antenna to pair with a new t.v. which was located in a room that has just a few viewers.  But, once I saw how clear and stable the channels were in that room, I decided to use this new antenna on the large screen t.v. in the living room, where most of my family watches t.v. The kicker is that I originally had the family room t.v. hooked up to an old, outdoor antenna (not digital), which often failed to keep a stable picture.  ( I live 40 miles away from the nearest t.v. tower.).  Once I switched to this little lightweight gem,  the local channels became clear, and stable.  There's no more of the going off and on, which I have endured for a long time.  This antenna I would recommend to anyone who's tired of settling for jumping screens .  Buy this antenna and you won't be sorry.

Great antenna. I actually mounted this on the glass of My patio Door wall and the reception if Great. I have had a hard time to a local station WJBK during windy weather. It was windy the other day and it never effected the reception. Make sure if You mount the antenna using the 3M mounting disks, make sure it is going to be in that place for a very long time. I was in a hurry and due to the cable connection piece, the door wouldn't' open all the way and I had to move it. the Mounted disks didn't want to come off the glass and I had to buy a couple new ones. That was My Fault and honestly no big deal. I now know the mounting disks will work for me if I ever need them again. Love, the antenna. This is My fourth one(no cable bill for me) and it works the best.

My 6 year old opened the package and insisted that he put it together and hook everything up. I took a step back and watched in amazement as he proceeded to plug everything in, connect all the cables and us the controller to set up the antenna on my Samsung TV. The process took less than 15 minutes so if you are someone who isn't very tech savvy please know that it's so easy to setup for even a first grader!Picture looks great and after everything is plugged in it works seamlessly! Great product for the price!
One of the best antennas we have bought yet. Such a clear picture!
The first lie: "Latest 2020"  Product available: Sept 2019The second lie: "120 mile range"

I live in a very rural area in the northern part of Colorado - just far enough away from many locations to do anything but have a satellite dish for TV stations.When I built the house in Colorado I made every effort to follow "the rules" for transferring my account from Virginia to the new place.  AT&T purchased DirecTV and just treated me like crap.  I was a 17 year subscriber of DirecTV and as I was making this move AT&T just cancelled my account without a reason why then forced me to resubscribe as a new user.

This is now the third flat indoor antenna I've purchased.  Each one has boasted greater miles in gain.  This one claimed 120, I thought finally one that would bring in all the OTA channels.  The furthest stations are about 60 miles from me so it should be no problem.  Nope, this antenna was about as useless as the previous others and I completely regret wasting my time and money.  It's connected properly, aimed appropriately and with no indoor interference and picks up less than a third of the stations out there.  So thoroughly disappointed.  Just out of curiosity I even ran this antenna outside and it barely gained any reception.  My suggestion to any of you who aren't very close to your broadcasting stations, stay away from products like this.  Get a real OUTDOOR antenna.

I just plugged in my HDTV antenna and the results were immediate. It doubled my available channels and my regular channels are clearer than they’ve ever been. Easy to install and I had my channels setup in under 5 minutes. Definitely recommend for my friends and family!

I purchased your antenna from Amazon and received it in 2 days.  Packaging in good shape no issues.  Installing the antenna was easy.  Instructions were very good and easy to understand.  Scanned for available channels and am picking up 33 in total.  Enjoying the FREE TV that we get over the air.  Thanks for saving me money on cable!!
Great antenna ! Just what I needed to watch local channels and NFL games.Good price!!!
excellent product ! I would recommend it to my friends and family!

I bought this to replace an old Wineguard unpowered flat antenna.  Even with power this only does marginally better at receiving stations and really I think that's only because I had to move it. My experience says that all of these flat antennas are the same (power or no power). This one was relatively expensive at $27 when you can find others $10 less here on Amazon.Some things I like about this antenna.....I like being able to plug it into the USB on the TV for power (not that it helps). I also like the 4 corner holes that allow me to pin it up without tape or those sticky strips.

I bought the HDTV Antenna yesterday and the package arrived today.  Ultra fast delivery, really happy about that.  But the best part is how easy and how powerful this antenna really is.  Bought this for the Toshiba Fire TV we have at the office (we are in City of Industry, California).  According to RCA Antenna App, our office actually faces away from the broadcast towers, but incredibly, we were able to get clear reception on most of the main channels (except for channel 7.1) with high clarity!  Everything took about 5 minutes.  Connected the coaxial and USB cable (most TV bought in the past 10 years should have at least one USB port, so you don’t even need the included power adapter, which eliminate cable management), and used the included double sided tape to mount the antenna on to the window (about 5 feet high).Cut your cable TV and get this! We get most of the content we watch from Netflix and Hulu any ways.  Great saving.

Based on a lot of favorable reviews I ordered this antenna in the hopes that I would be able to use it to view the local over the air major network channels in the Austin area.  Per google maps I live 32 miles as the crow flies from the Austin over the air local stations broadcast towers.  The antenna was able to pull down quite a few channels.  However, most of them were for programming I have no interest in whatsoever.  Of the channels I was able to receive the picture quality varied depending on the channel from good to not so good.  In spite of repositioning the antenna a few times I was only able to pull down the over the air signal from only one of the local network affiliates.  I knew before I ordered the antenna that it would be a hit or miss proposition but unfortunately the antenna was a miss in my circumstance and did not work for me to be able to view all of the local network affiliate broadcast channels.

Probably under ideal circumstances this indoor antenna would pull in more channels.  I received 12 DTV channels - 4 with no connection, 3 in Spanish, Court TV, some channels with TV shows from the 70s, and one complete NBC station.  Except for NBC logo there was no channel designation like TNT or FX.  Picture from NBC was very sharp, colorful, and didn’t suffer lags or breakups. I live in suburban Philadelphia. We are lucky to have lots of area TV towers. I see no reason why there was only one useful channel.FYI:  I installed the antenna on a window as recommended, but when placed high on the wall above my (new) TV it actually brought in a few more channels.  My streaming TV is in a spare room.  I also have Verizon FIOs and get complete channel coverage in other rooms.  Cord cutters should be aware that the best reception might be in a room you don’t want a TV.  I found that Pluto (free) TV offers hundreds TV shows and movies for streaming if commercials don’t bother you.  In addition to transferring sports on cable to streaming, I also subscribe to Netflix, Amazon Prime, HBO MAX, EPIX, and Brit Box...all commercial free. I found the price of a specific cable package is within $5 of the new $65 YouTube Live TV.  Cable instantly connects...no spinning circles.

We recently got rid of our satellite television package. Most of what we watch we stream. We wanted an option to be able to see our local channels. We live in a very rural mountainous area so we did not have high expectations.Set up was simple and after running the scan we ended up with 13 channels. There are only 4 broadcast stations within a 60 mile radius so the range on this must be as described.

Admittedly,  I rarely write reviews,  but I felt as though this antenna deserved a shout out. A few years ago and after receiving mysterious bills from my cable company in the middle of billing cycles (you know who they are...rhymes with "Con-cast"), I cut the cord and bought an antenna.  I don't remember the brand but it was okay.  I live in Chicago and even though the broadcast signals were fairly close,  I was unable to get a few major networks.  I tried moving it around and still couldn't get the same channels,  and the ones I could get would lose the signal if it was raining or too windy. I smashed it when the signal cut out during the Packers game.  I  saw this brand,  read the reviews and decided to try it.  After a channel scan. I was able to receive 17 more channels than with the other crappy antenna...and not just receive them, but at full strength with no disconnections. Even in temperamental weather,  I can see everything as it should.  Best brand on the market.

The few channels that it received were good. In my area I have over 10 stations available well within the advertised range of this antenna. On the first programing attempt I did not get any. I moved the antenna from the wall to a window across the room. It found four stations, only 3 of them go good quality. The stations that were programmed were within twenty miles of my house, not the advertised 120 miles.
Reception is fantastic great product very happy. We now have 62 channels.

I got three statiions from the anteena.  They were all PBS stations from Bloominton Indiana where IU is located.  This anteena is suppose to get stations 120 miles away.  Inidnapoils is 50 miles away which CBS, Fox, NBC and ABC is located which I can't get.  So the product is not as advertized.  I was hoping to get those stations so I could get rid of satalite.  I haven't decided to return the anteena yet.  Maybe I could get some help to get the network stations.  I've moved the anteena all around the house to no prevail.

It's good, but it's not magic... let me explain... I have a 2 level home, I wanted it for the ground floor, long story short... I didn't work, not even with the "amplifier" or moving it around like a cellphone in the 90's I could get it to get a strong signal... after that, tried it in the second level, strong signal this time, awesome picture quality.. so its good but if you have a signal weak spot or your tv is not in the best location... no different from a $6 antenna in my experience, hell I went back to the $6 one that I knew where to locate to give me the bare min...

I was trying to get a haupage usb tuner to work with a wire dipole but that wasn't working.  So I bought this.  I tried it through two walls, didn't work so great.I was over at my sisters that lives two miles away, she had the same thing and it was working fine.

Sadly for me this thing doesn’t work very well at all.  I can’t figure out how this thing is directional as some state.  I get little to no channels with this mounted on the wall facing into my room.  I point it the other way towards the towers in Seattle and just as bad or worse.  The best signal I got was the thing laying on a ladder facing up?  In short there is no reasonable place to mount this thing where I get a good signal.  I even tried my FB upstairs and only got 3 channels.  How I got 17 downstairs and only 3 upstairs is apparently a mystery.
The best antenna I've seen lately.Thank you for making such a quality product!

I figured I could get regular franchise broadcast stations. You know: ABC, CBS, NBC, and maybe a few local ones like KTLA, KCOP, etc. No. These stations were not among those found. The receiver found 1 Spanish-language station, 1 infomercial station, I English-language station playing some completely forgettable movie and 14 Asian-language stations, evenly split between Chinese-language & Vietnames with some Tagalog & Hindi thrown in for variety.So, with this device I can watch none of the stations I want to, but I can watch many I don't want to! It's like a double-bonus, or is that double-bogus.

I ordered the antenna for an upstairs bedroom TV we don't use very often. Instead of paying the cable company $12/month forever for yet another cable box, we decided to give this unit a try as a $28 "experiment". Install we easy, scanning for channels took a few minutes, but we ended with 18 "free" channels, enough to satisfy our need for that tv. Channels include NBC, FOX, PBS (3 channels), ION & ION Plus, several shopping channels, etc. We live in suburban Portland, OR in an area with my valleys and hills. I suspect we could pull in more channels if we live a  flatter terrain. Going to recommend this unit to my adult son (with no cable) who lives in downtown Portland.
I needed to edit my previous review. I had blamed the antenna as being defective and "junk".Well, it's not junk. It works outstanding!

We recently cancelled our expensive directv account but we missed our local channels.  I ordered this antenna and was very pleased with it.  The slim design fits anywhere.  The reception is great and it was extremely easy to connect to our tv.  The price was fair and it is saving us a lot of money.
Muy bueno

I was afraid to cut the cord with cable but setting up your antenna was easy peasy and took no time. Any idiot can do it. Scanned tv for stations and now I have exactly what I need. Thanks for explicit direction. Even this old lady could do it!!!!  ☺️

Bought the antenna in an attempt to get local channels on our TV. Tried another from Walmart before I bought this one, but neither one worked. No channels on the scan. It simply doesn't pick up the channels. I dunno, maybe I'm too far from the tower or simply facing the wrong direction, but for whatever reason, this thing does not work.It also came repackaged. It's not a new antenna as someone before me had it unwrapped and parts and pieces put into the bag. The cord was wrapped haphazardly and the twist tie was undone and had obviously been redone a number of times. Frustrating.

I just installed the HDTV antenna. The installation was straight forward and took less than 5 minutes. My signal is way better than with a traditional bunny ear antenna. I would recommend to a friend.
I'm truly impressed with my new HSTV ANTENNA, I now can tune in to over 60 channels!  Wow...AMAZING!
I have been able to pick up 47 channels including ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX, PBS. In Connecticut I have been able to pick up New York stations.

THE BEST ANTENNA WHICH I HAVE HAS EVEN!I live more than 60 miles from the nearest tv tower and continue to receive all my favorite channels. this is unbelievable! I plan to purchase 3 more and completely cut the cable!

Installation for me wasn't quite that easy. The font was small on the instructions and it was a pain tightening the coax cable. Wound up looking at the pictures in the instructions for help. Tried with and without amplifier; got more channels with it. My old CRT TV needed a separate coaxial cable for the converter box which was not supplied. Put the antenna, using two of the four sticky disks, on the window as high as I could, figuring I would get a massive amount of channels. Nope. Not much better than my old rabbit ears. Set TV to do a manual search and fooled around with antenna placement until  ION Network (hard to get in my area) started showing a strong signal. Plopped the antenna at that spot, which is on the wall about five feet from the original location. Rescanned. Works great, coming in with over 45 chaennels. So, do mess with that antenna until you find a good spot.

I purchased this HDTV antenna for our basement TV. I wasn't sure if we would get good enough reception in the basement, but I decided to take a chance based on the reviews I read of this item. I installed the new antenna today and was pleasantly surprised to see that I am able to receive over 35 channels, even with the antenna being located in the basement. The picture is clear as well. I am happy with my purchase so far.

Ordered the latest 2019 Amplified HD Digital Antenna Long 120 Mile Range antenna so I receive local channels.  Installation was easy and I had it running it only a few minutes.I tried the antenna in several locations (even in the window) but settled on placing it flat on the top of our entertainment center.  Moving it around did not give me additional channels than the original 12 I got in the first location.  At one location it said I had 17 and even up to 21 channels but the additional channels were either only partially coming in or not coming in at all.

Tried to use product to upgrade prior indoor antenna. Spent hours shifting its location and rescanning for channels.Obtained six to nine, while older indoor antenna received twenty digital. While seller promises 120-mile radius, couldn't get digital broadcasts within 50 miles that were accessible by competitor brands. Since it probably costs more to mail in for warranty, I'll likely trash and absorb cost of bad decision.

Very easy to hookup, but did not get a single channel where I live about 60 miles north of Concord / Manchester NH and 120 miles from Boston. Very disappointed, but consistent with other antennas I have tried. As they say "If it is too good to be true, it most likely isn't true." Don't believe the hype on this one.Returning ASAP
Finally, an antenna that works.

Amazing.  We are blown away at how great this Antenna works.  We have told so many friends about.  This is our 1st time buying one. Got 28 channels on first try.  When we moved slightly and Wow! Now we have 35 channels.  Highly recommend

This is the third indoor HD antenna I have tried and finally found a great one!  Last two would not pick up any channels and this one does great.  10-20 channels but most importantly all the local network stations come in crystal clear.  Very pleased!
This was an easy setup. The hardest part was getting the ladder out. It is inside the house above a bank of windows. I tested the TV channel scan before I attached it to the wall.

It seems the antenna picked up less signal at my home, which is more densely populated. The reception improved in a more open location. Give it a try in your area, hopefully you will have a chance to beat the cable tv company!!

We bought this thinking it would get alot more channels than the $4 antenna we bought at a big box store.  Well it actually got less channels.  No matter where we put it, less channels than a very cheap antenna.  Its going back

I couldn't be happier with this antenna. I discontinued my DirectTV service because of poor service after AT&T acquired them. I was only using 10 channels anyway so it was a waste of money.Now I use Roku with my WiFi and everyone in the family is happy. But there was one problem: no live sports or news unless I get Hulu or Sling or another live TV provider.

due to the cable TV companies constant  rate increases , I had no choice but to cancel  cable Tv . Upon looking around for other options, I found your web site and decided to order the HDTV ANTENNA. Upon receiving the antenna in the mail, the installation took approximately 2 minutes to install which included reviewing the instruction manual. Well, I was very surprised to see how many channels I had access to, and in HIGH DEF.I was able to get channels that the cable company doesn't even offer. And to get the old reruns of the game shows from the 70' s and 80's along with the black and white sitcoms from the 70's I was impressed. I would recommend your HDTV ANTENNA to everyone who's sick of paying those outrageous cable bills. Wish I had found  this antenna sooner. The price is very reasonable. And for parents with children, there are many kids channels available Thank you HDTV.

the product was shipped in an Amazon Box with the manufacturers box inside... I have a HUGE suspicion it was a return open box item the way the package opening end was mangled.  it definitely looked like a repack....  so that is one strike....  I am going to contact Amazon today.Hooked up the antenna to a Samsung 4k 60" TV and scanned the channels... for an indoor antenna it worked fairly well with some issues on the more distant stations,  the transmitters are at best 20 miles from the house... so,  120mile range is probably a long shot.

I purchased this antenna on Amazon as a gift and it was a hit! My friend and I set it up on her Samsung Smart HDTV. Once we were up and scanning it picked up about 46 channels in the first few seconds. The total number of channels in the area (Washington State) came over 80. Best of all, there was no noticeable signal drops while watching TV. The powered part of this antenna really made a difference over my old non-powered antenna in signal quality and strength.Installation was as easy as plugging things in and fixing the antenna to a wall. We literally had it put together in two minutes.

This product is absolutely amazing! As a streaming family we do not have regular cable and have not for years. But we missed our local channels. There are not very many options for getting our local channels and with the recent COVID-19 outbreak it is important to keep up-to-date with information. Local news channels are important this is an amazing product to remain a streaming family and not add any monthly payment with expensive cable service. Highly recommended I now have almost 50 local channels. This product is absolutely amazing! As a streaming family we do not have regular cable and have not for years. But we missed our local channels. There are not very many options for getting our local channels and with the recent COVID-19 outbreak it is important to keep up-to-date with information. Local news channels are important this is an amazing product to remain a streaming family and not add any monthly payment with expensive cable service. Highly recommended I now have almost 50 local channels

The antenna was easy to install. They included Velcro squares in case you need them to mount it.  Several channels come in but NBC does not come on mine so no Thursday night football for us. There are only so many places I can try moving the antenna to; the cord is fairly long but it is not infinite. I could not really tell that the short range/long range switch actually changed anything other than the light changes colors from amber to green. Overall, it’s a one time fee to pick up several channels. Not bad investment. If only NBC would come in....

I already knew that we have strong signals in Tucson AZ, and line of sight to the transmission towers on a nearby mountain. It found 21 channels. The important matter for us that reception for local channels is crystal clear, as clear as cable. (A note to people hearing/seeing ads for these things: They do not replace cable with all the services and channels available from cable or satellite tv. You will get what is broadcast locally, like ABC, NBC, Fox, CBS, Univision, which will include some extra services as "side channels" provided by local tv, but is not going to include things like ESPN, CNN, History, premium services. You will get your local network channels plus some others like Bounce. This product shows channels in their photos which are not likely to be available as they are typically not broadcast locally, like CNN, ESPN, Nickelodeon.)

I have been using antennas for years now,  for about a decade after cutting the cord.  I used to only receive the basic stations that you would normally expect.  I had been using one of those old bunny ears antennas for years and didnt have any reason to update.  Well, my bunny ears stopped working and it was time for something new.  I just was not sure what to get and had to depend on reviews and ratings here.  I have to say this is 5 star quality! The second i finished installing the antenna channels immediately started coming in. I got all my basics, in crystal clear HD as well as dozens upon dozens of other stations i had never even heard of. Movies, tv shows, talk shows, news, weather- everything.  Literally dozens of free, crystal clear vivid HD channels.Get this antenna and you will will not need cable ever again.

The install was very easy and instructions well done.  Put the antenna in a window facing the direction of the stations I wanted to receive (antennasdirect website has a great tool for identifying stations and the direction to point the antenna).  I scanned for channels and did find several digital TV signals that it created channels for, but most were not watchable.  The picture would freeze, get pixelation, go black, or show digital artifacts on most of them.  Maybe 1 was relatively stable for watching.  My stations are 35-45 miles away and show as having weak signals in my area.  I'm in a wooded area, and it is summer as I write this, so lots of trees with leaves on them between me and the stations I was pointing at.  I thought (was hoping) an antenna rated for 200 miles might be able to pull in a weak station from 45 miles away, but that is not the case here, so looks like I'll be keeping my streaming service for local channels, or looking for a more powerful antenna, perhaps an externally mounted one.  Returned the item for a full refund so no complaint with the return policy when it proved to not work for me.

We kicked TV cable and our satellite dish service to the curb last year and have been streaming programs we want to watch. The thing is, we miss out on local news, live sports broadcasts, and other things. We decided to host some friends over to watch the Super Bowl LIV football game, but how to watch it? Then I remembered reading that local stations still broadcast signals and are available to watch if you have a digital antenna. SO, on 1/27/20, we ordered a GESOBYTE Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna. It arrived only four days later.I must admit I had fairly low expectations of its potential performance. We live in a small-sized city in a semi-rural area. This thin plastic sheet antenna seemed awfully small. More than that, it cost less than half of just one month fees from our old cable service. I figured we might be able to pick up maybe three or four stations still broadcasting some kind of content in our area. (I still remember the shadowy picture we picked up from the enormous roof antenna we had back when I was a kid. Even with that huge aluminum antenna high on the roof, we only got four stations.) Still, the only other option to watch the game was to go back to paying the ridiculous prices charged by the local cable company. No way was I going to do that! Whatever picture we did or didn’t pick up from this antenna would just have to be good enough.

Cut the cable cord Monday after prices had risen another $10 this month. My UMustHave HDTV digital antenna arrived Wednesday. It took a solid 3-4 minutes to setup including removing it from the box. Very easy. The most difficult aspect is screwing the coaxial cable to the television. We have our antenna in a nearby window and receive 45 digital channels including all of the local channels. Alas there is no ESPN; however, with the $220 monthly saved from ditching cable I could easily pick up a streaming service that carries it and still be saving a fistful of dollars. Have I mentioned the HD local channels are actually sharper than they were with cable? I already found two great channels, Decades TV and Comet TV, I love and I still haven't fully investigated every channel we receive. I can't believe how uneasy I was to free myself from the cable tyranny. Seriously. I should have done this last year and saved a couple Thousand Dollars! Oh, it's been raining nonstop all day with no loss in signal. My overpriced cable would have been dropping intermittently throughout. Unbelievable. I'm thrilled with my UMustHave antenna; I have 2 additional televisions and will be getting one for each. Thank you for delivering a quality, reasonably priced product that actually works as it should.

I ordered this product, because I was having trouble with cable TV, and I wanted to be able to watch the networks during the interim. I was confident that if I wasn’t satisfied, Amazon would accept the return.It was delivered yesterday, and I installed it today. I receive about 30 channels in West Palm Beach Florida, including all the major networks. I had attempted to use an indoor antenna a few years ago, and it did not work satisfactorily. This one works great, and it’s easy to use the amplifier by plugging in the USB into the port on the back of the television.

I ordered this antenna and within one day it was at my door. I immediately installed it. I am 72 years young. The installation was very simple and straightforward. I was able to get 126 channels. I was paying a lot of money for just the local channels.  I get those and a lot more now. The picture and the sound is perfect. Can’t tell the difference between this and my cable service. I Will not be missing my expensive cable bill at all. I highly recommend this antenna.

I'm not great with tech stuff, but this item was user-friendly and easy to set up. I was able to save money by getting rid of cable, and getting the basic channels with this antenna. If you use the government dtv maps website, you can put in your zip code, and they will tell you how likely you are to get certain local channels, and what direction they are from you, so you can try to face the antenna in that direction. I did not need the amplifier they sent,  since I am not too far from the tv station satellites. Once in a while the TV reception gets a little choppy, but it also did that when I had cable, so I am not complaining! Love this item!

To be clear, this is replacing a unit I already have; I'm comparing this product to my current antenna.  The good: it's easy to set up and picks up 28 channels.  The only picture and sound that is watchable are Fox and two Spanish channels.  The other 25 channels are barely watchable.  My current (non-powered antenna) I get the same watchable result and 11 channels overall.  The bad: When I turn on the TV, the unit isn't working, and I have NO channels.  I have to go through the tuning process every time.  I don't have this issue with my passive antenna, so I know this is an attribute to this product and will return to Amazon.
This is an updated after a couple of weeks of purchased it.The quality is still Good in some channels but we have lost many of the channels that we got when we first set it up.

Very easy setup, straight forward and direct. Hung it on my lamp, un-coiled the coax cable, screwed it to the signal booster, plugged the  USB adapter in to an outlet, plugged the USB from booster to adapter and connected the coax from booster to TV...done. Turned the TV on went to antennae settings and scanned for channels. After a few minutes I am up and running. On average my channels are getting 4-5/5 signal strength.I live 31 miles east of Mount Wilson Observatory in San Bernardino County where the broadcasting antennae’s are at.

When I first picked up the Amazon box I was a little confused.  I knew what was inside but it was so light I thought it was just an empty box.  Well the GESOBYTE Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna is rather flimsy, being just a piece of plastic about twice as large as a typical mouse pad & only half as thick but it works.  I use Plex & two HDHomerun HDTV tuners for my over-the-air reception.  A few months ago, here in Tampa, the local NBC station "reconfigured" their antenna to, as they said, provide better coverage.  I don't know what they did, but the local Tampa AVS Forum began to fill up with nothing but complaints.  At first I lost all reception, but about 3 month later I could get a signal but it was unwatchable as it was constantly breaking up.  Enter this device.  The actual install took about 30 minutes.  Just off my kitchen is a linen closet that my wife let me take over as my "server" closet.  Among other things installed there is the aforementioned Plex server, the digital tuners, & my 25 Terabyte storage server.  Also, this is where I had installed an 8-dollar pair of rabbit ears & coax splitter.  I swapped out the rabbit ears for the GESOBYTE & my NBC reception problems disappeared.  Again, the product feels super flimsy & frankly I attribute its success to the built in amplifier as the antenna can scarcely be more than a piece of wire but is well worth the price.  Hat tip - make sure to turn the ON/OFF switch to ON (green light) before use!  LOL

This one was just like all the other Flat antennas you see all over and on TV. Supposedly has a plug in Booster that you plug in your wall outlet, no change in reception plugged in or not! Also, mounted it to the window for the best reception right? Well try to remove it from the window to relocate it to another flat surface or another window, the whole Sticky part of it Ripped from the unit itself when I tried to remove it from the window, exposing the little wires that connect to the flat part!! What garbage and wasted of money!!! Scanned the TV for channels, got less than 30 free channels! Ended up buying a 2 foot bar type antenna, with a heavy base that sits on the window sill, and a extra coaxial cable to hook up to 2 TV's, got over 60 channels! Different brand of coarse from a local department store. DON'T BUY...you will be sorry!

My wife and I decided that since we were the only ones using cable in the home, it was an absurd expense.  Snip-snap! And the cable was gone.  After reviewing the various antenna choices on Amazon, this was the obvious choice for an indoor antenna solution.Now we have our local channels and the kids have their streaming via the internet.  Everyone is happy and the monthly budget is saving over $200/month.  Found money, found easy!

I have a 65" LG mounted to a wall. I initially put the antenna on the back of the TV and ran a channel search. I was disappointed when my TV said it only found 18 channels and FOX wasn't one of them. I then moved the Antenna to sit on the mount that touches the wall about 6 inches away from the TV and I was happy that after running the Channel scan, it found 48 channels. I didn't put it close to a window or anything and it sits behind the TV hidden from view. Love how small it is and that you'd never know it was there if you didn't look behind the TV. Came with everything I needed to mount it but Its so thin I just slipped it between the mount and the wall. I've had other 100+ roof mount antenna's that didn't get the same result as this. Very happy.

Needed an antenna for a patio TV.  The antenna was easy to install on a new Hisense 32 inch smart TV.  I placed the antenna high on the wall.  Our patio is enclosed, so there is no exposure to weather.  I was able to bring in 33 channels, with a net number of 25, subtracting duplicate programs onnnother channels.  The same number of channels was received in both amplified and non amplified modes.  The length of cable is a perfect to position the antenna.  There is sticky pads included to secure antenna to a good surface.  Since we live in a valley and the TV stations are about 50 miles away, the picture quality and number of channels is excellent.  I did run a check on the number of stations possible in our area and the antenna receives all of them plus.

I live in a first floor condo - so my only option besides Comcast cable to get local stations would be an indoor antenna. I tried this out on my neighbor's small TV with rabbit ears. Rabbit ears only got 2 channels and poor picture. With this antenna placed in a window facing south he could pick up 9 channels with good picture. Decided to buy a small TV to set up in my bedroom - windows face SW. I was able to pick up 21 channels! The amplifier on this antenna makes a huge difference as I am over 60 miles to the nearest station. As long as you have no obstructions ( like a building or mountain blocking your signal) and you have a window facing the correct direction this indoor antenna should work for you.

I purchased this indoor antenna for use with a 2013 model Vizio television in Chandler, AZ.  The broadcast range for us was not the 150 mile possibility as advertised in the description, but much closer for our television.  The antenna arrived promptly with Prime.  My husband took it out of the box and had it installed, including scanning for channels, in about ten minutes. After using it for several days we checked online the availability of the channels in our area. There were several channels that weren't even showing up, so my husband repositioned the antenna, placing it directly on the window with the included stickers. He scanned again.  Bingo!--more of the channels that we were missing.  It is wise to check several different locations for mounting the antenna for optimum viewing.  After leaving a review on Amazon the seller sent us a second antenna completely free with free shipping.  If you're tired of being gouged by the cable and satellite companies for what is free with the assistance of an antenna, give this a try!

Hi, we purchased two amplified digital indoor HDTV antennas from “u must have”. We live in Sun City Arizona, and the broadcast signal towers are about 30 miles away on top of South Mountain. We have been using more expensive TERK antennas, and have not been happy with them. For one thing the TERK antennas do not bring in the five PBS broadcast stations, which we miss dearly.  I began searching for a better antenna and found the “u must have it” antennas on Amazon. After reading all the recent reviews I ordered two Antennas. They shipped quickly. We do not have extra outlets to plug in the amplified accessory, so we just hooked up the antennas to the tv, and used double-back tape (included) to mount the antenna on the wall. I admit I had my doubts about the antenna, because it is so lightweight and slightly floppy (not rigid at all). But when I ran a channel scan this floppy little antenna brought on 73 channels, including all 5 PBS channels. The antenna is hung on the wall above the tv, not in a window, but across the room from a window. The second antenna is in a bedroom, and we just slid the antenna into the top of a bookcase rather than attach it to the wall. The bookcase is on the opposite wall of the window. The tv is on the bookcase as well, and again we did not hook up the amplifier. The channel scan brought in 62 channels, including all 5 PBS stations. We are extremely happy with the “u must have” antennas! The price is wonderful too. Thank you!

Hello,I wanted to share my experience with you business after purchasing one of your HDTV Antenna's. First, I would like to say that the product is very lightweight and easy to install in any place needed to get a better signal. I unboxed the product and installed it in my fifth wheel camper for our family camping trips. It was very easy to assemble and install to our living room TV. After connecting to the TV and placing the thin antenna near our camper window, I ran a channel search on our TV. This antenna located enough channels to keep the family entertained during our relaxing nights in the camper. The HD channel quality was second to none and worth buying. I would highly recommend this HDTV antenna to anyone looking to get HD quality channels wherever they go.

I recently purchased the GESOBYTE Amplified HD digital TV antenna, and I’m super happy with the full lineup of channels that I am receiving in the Chicagoland area; local news, sports, and lots of sitcom’s, I was surprised to see the wide array of channels that I could get with just a digital antenna and not having cable TV, and although it was advertised to support 4K/1080 P picture quality, it was truly incredible to see… The picture quality is better than cable TV.All in all this product is a great value for the money, and I highly recommend everyone gives it a try before spending on cable TV subscription fees.

When considering there are dozens of Television Indoor Antennae manufacturers and models, I decided to research the best selling indoor antenna, along with reviewing Amazon customer reviews before selecting the Gesobyte. I'm pleased that I selected Gesobyte.  It works, and it works well.  I quickly installed the Gesobyte, and that process probably takes 5 minutes, or even less.  The Gesobyte comes with a long cable, (black in color), and an attached antennae amplifier device that has a short and long-range switch.  The amplifier is designed to either plug into your USB port on the back of the television, or the amplifier  plugs into a regular wall outlet if your TV has no USB port.  Quick, simple and no need for most to even read the supplied instructions.  The antennae itself, which is a flat mat that seems to be about 8" x 8" in size, easily mounts to a window or wall location that you choose, and has three (supplied) 3M sticking pads.  The Gesobyte instructions DO make it clear that you MUST be aware of the location and direction of your television broadcasting station(s) for the best signal reception.  Thankfully, the Gesobyte provides info about an internet link that you can first access to determine (through your zip code) where the broadcasting channels are located in proximity to your residence.  It's quick, and simple, and even the Federal Communication Commission (FCC) has a similar website that provides the same info.  When using my old indoor antennae, I received eight or nine channels but after installing the Gesobyte I then received 24 channels.  Yes, really.  However, I did find it necessary to locate the BEST location to place the antennae, as recommended by Gesobyte, and that process may require the purchaser to have a few trial and error attempts.  As a general rule, you simply place the Gesobyte where it faces the broadcasting stations and that location could be a window, an adjacent area near a window, a table, wall, or any area that (ideally) has the correct location toward broadcasting without obstructions.  I mention all of this because I've also seen negative reviews of the Gesobyte.  It is likely some who own the Gesobyte didn't take the time to just make a few attempts to arrive at the best place to install it.  Anyway, the Gesobyte works well with my old model-year 2008 Sony TV, and the picture on each channel is incredibly clear without fading at all.  It's great to NOT be a subscriber of Cable, and to see  such an improvement over my old indoor antennae.  This Gesobyte is affordable, and I highly recommend it, too !

Ok, I did say a prayer before installation! Hey, I am a nurse so electronics are not my forte. Of course I disconnected TV first then followed easy written instructions and it was quick and easy. I was amazed with the clarity and sharpness of the picture. The view is as clear and as good as having cable, I kid you not! Initially, I placed the antenna in my window but noticed that when it was raining or windy, the picture had lots of gaps. Consequently, I moved it off the window but near it and it solved the problem. I get all the channels it’s box mentioned and more. In total, I am getting 35 channels, not counting the several Chinese speaking channels. You may be asking “why did you resort to getting an antenna?” My answer is that I got fed up with greed in part of cable companies. I was paying $160.00 for cable and a land line I never used. Now I have all the channels I want and need and get to keep my money to do other things. Greed is going to put the cable and the digital companies out of business and luckily for us, the consumers, the new law is for all networks to allow all satellites signals to be picked up by antennas. Es la ley and I am loving it! The best part about this particular antenna is that it comes with its own amplifier and everything you need. Enjoy the view. This seller was a great and fast speedy Gonzalez!

We're in the process of cutting the cord and we decided to try this antenna, purchased through Amazon. The positive reviews led us to try it. It was our first antenna purchase ever. We ordered the antenna for the bedroom so we could get local channels.We are very impressed with this antenna. We were not expecting it to produce positive results, but boy we were pleasantly surprised! The antenna itself is very thin and light - not bulky or heavy at all.

I already had a Mohu Leaf 50 positioned high up in a window, in one location serving a sat receiver that had died, where I needed a quick solution.  That had worked out reasonably well, which was my first evidence that these flat panel type antennas could work.  (I'm well aware of the tv broadcast tower line-of-sight factor, sites like TVFool.com, and that any of these antenna solutions tend to be a YMMV thing, depending on your location and where you can place the antenna.)  Skip ahead a couple years, and Spectrum TV just effectively doubled their bill, when it only served one room in my house, and was seldom used at all.  To the tune of $1,200. / year ?!  I don't think so !  The verdict: BYE BYE SPECTRUM !  Luckily this alternative worked.  It gets the three major local channels I cared about most, with pretty good results.  I also bought a Winegard flat panel antenna -- just in case, and seeing as the total expenditure for both was around 50 bucks -- but have not tried that one out yet.Some more details: without the amplifier piece, this one claimed to bring in about 14 channels, but only around 9 actually showed up.  They were all viewable or better.  Due to a not so great design placement for the coax connector on that small tv, attaching the antenna cable was difficult (very tight spacing, to the point that the smallest needle-nose pliers I could find could barely fit in for tightening the ring), but I was able to work around that with an adapter from the hardware store.  Using the small amplifier piece from this kit, the antenna claimed to find 65 stations, but could only display 11 of them in the tv tuner's channel list.  Mostly the same channels that showed up before, without the amplifier, but the signal was improved for some of them.  Overall and so far, I'd rate this purchase a success.

The Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna Long 120 Miles Range is the best purchase I made this year - and it cost me just under $30!! I mounted the antenna high on the wall and scanned for channels. To my surprise, it had pulled in thirty channels. For three days, I've tuned to most of them and each channel did not flicker or drop out. As of writing, I've used the antenna for four days - the channels received were phenomenally clear and pristine. My wife stated that she had forgotten that we watching "over-the-air" television, and she was right!I highly recommend this product, even if you live 25 miles from a TV broadcast tower. I'll bet you'll find that may have more "over-the-air" stations that you expected.

I wanted to be able to get basic channels on a television in our house that is not used much. I did not want to put it on our subscription plan and I did not want it to require wi-fi so I searched for HDTV antennas on Amazon.com. After studying five different models/brands, I decided  to purchase your HDTV antenna.I love this antenna for several reasons, including the reasons I stated above. It literally did take me five minutes to install this on my tv.  My tv is hd, but it is about eight years old so I was unsure I would get good results.  I did....I get a good clear picture. Using the stickers provided, I stuck the antenna on the wall near my set and scanned, getting 85 digital channels. Although I will not use all the channels, we receive all our local and news channels, plus several other channels we will occasionally view.

The unpacking and instructions for how to connect to the TV are very easy.  No matter where I placed the antenna (high, low, near a window, etc) or in what direction, only one more channel was added to the two that my TV picks up with no antenna.  My TV had a tuning screen so that you could see the signal strength, never was better than 42 out of 100.

My wife and I are considering cutting the cord and moving away from cable, but it's a tough decision. Part of it was going to be what kind of TV we could get OTA--it seems stupid to dump a $70 cable package with 1,000 channels and a DVR for YouTube or Hulu charging $55-$65 for like 100 channels (0r less) and no DVR. My TV has a digital tuner built in so I did the whole "scan for channels" thing to see what would happen. I got 16 channels, all the big local networks and some of which didn't come in very well. Not enough to cut the cord, but a start.So I started looking into digital antennae and based on the over 8,500 positive reviews, I decided to give this one a try. I was a bit skeptical due to the (falsely) advertised 200-mile range, since there's no such thing as a 200-mile range digital antenna (the curvature of the Earth limits any antenna to 80 miles maximum--it's an issue of physics), but I figured I'd give it a go.

We gave up cable many years ago and have been using old-time rabbit ears and old technology digital antennas. We finally got fed up with not receiving two of our favorite local channels on a consistent basis. We had to search for them almost every day and move the antenna all over the room to get reception.We searched for a new antenna on Amazon and came across the GB amplified HD digital TV antenna. It has great reviews, so we chose to purchase it.  We received it last week and we LOVE it!  It was easy to install and we immediately got the two local channels we wanted, plus others we never knew we could have. This product is awesome for people like us who find it ridiculous to pay for cable in the streaming age of television.

I bought this to watch some shows on the major networks, which were not provided by my internet TV service.I had an old-style tabletop antenna, which I plugged in, and it does okay, giving us some 10-15 channels in the metro Atlanta area.  The only way to get reception, though, was to put the antenna in the middle of the room, and not go near it!

The “rabbit ears” antenna we had wasn’t giving the local channels we wanted on a TV in a room that’s half in-ground with no windows nearby. I saw that this antenna has an extra long cable and can receive signals from all directions, and I decided to give it a try.It’s very easy to install. We used little 3M hooks to keep the cable flush against the wall as it stretched from the TV to a window in another room. I played around a bit with the position of the antenna and we finally got the channels we wanted.

Our satellite service discontinued FOX.  I'm so sick of this behavior.  So, we bought this antenna.  I wasn't expecting much as we live 40 miles from the nearest city.  But we have 21 stations!  FREE!  We were even able to watch them in a storm!  Take that satellite service!But seriously... we have an unusual house with few options for antenna placement.  I opted to try it on the most unlikely location, an interior wall facing west (the city of east).  We have 21 local/network channels and only two of them don't get the best signal.  All of the major network stations are perfect.  This is just on the first try!  I'll move the antenna to new locations this weekend to see if we can get a better signal.  But I'm truly impressed so far.

Just installed the antenna at my mom's room in her assisted living facility.  We were very pleased at the ease of the install as well as the number of channels we were able to get.  We mounted the antenna close to the ceiling and right above a window in the bedroom on a exterior wall. The house has some sort of radiant foil underlay to help maintain the temperature of the house installed under the roof and we were concerned about how well this would work since it tends to interfere with with tower signals,  it actually works great and are very happy the results.  We purchased the antenna on amazon and received it the next day.  Will be getting more of these to so we can eliminate our costly cable. My husband is a hard sell but even he  was impressed with ease of install and channels we are able to receive.

We are delighted with this HD Digital Antenna.  It is so thin and lightweight - easy to work with!It installed and had scanned for our local channels in less than 15 minutes. Finding an indoor location proved to be easy so we have not had to experiment with placing it outside.  We installed it on a very cloudy day but were able to get over 35 local channels. We got the ones we specifically wanted.

I bought and installed this HDTV Antenna rated for 100 miles. I had a similar one installed and have used it for several years. It supposedly was to pull in the stations within 35 miles. It did an okay job but did not get one of the main channels here in our city and that station 10 miles away. I installed your antenna and it brings everything I had before clearer than ever plus it gets the missing channels. It was an easy install (especially since I could disconnect and see exactly where to reconnect) which took about 10 minutes total time. And that includes cleaning all the dust from behind the TV. LOL. It is not perfect but it is fantastic for the price. I love cable cutting!

I mounted this up near a gable vent near the peak of the roof in my attic which feeds a 4-way splitter that goes to the other TVs in my house. Since I didn't have an electrical outlet in the attic to power this antenna, I bought a light socket that has 2 outlets (readily available at any store or online) and ran a short extension cord to the antenna and I'm getting nearly 40 channels, many which are coming from out of state! I was hoping just to catch the local broadcasters and ended picking up distant ones too. We'll see how long this holds up in my attic, but if it makes it over a year in those conditions I will be thoroughly impressed!

I am thrilled with your product!  I installed my new antenna last night and was thrilled to see SO many channels identified while my auto channel process was in play. ABC, CBS, NBC all coming in clearly! My local PBS station, and several of my local stations in NH.  Had been using an older wall-mounted antenna that provided just 5 channels since I dropped all cable tv service 3 months ago (another great decision).

My experience:First of all, I was extremely skeptical that this square piece of plastic would be any better than other so-called "powerful" digital antennas I'd already tried in the past. In all fairness to those other antennas, and for the sake of full transparency in offering my opinion of your antenna vs. those "other" antennas I've tried before, I must say, I live in an urban area where the homes are very crammed together, which tends to cause much interference when trying to get ANY signals at all, even those local channels which are broadcast only 5-10 miles from my home. With my previous antennas, I was lucky (on a clear day with fair weather) to pick up even 4 or 5 solid channels that wouldn't lose signal strength (or fail to come in at all), with the slightest change in wind or weather conditions. Again, in remaining transparent in this review, I've only been using your antenna for a couple weeks, and we haven't had any adverse weather lately, other than some strong winds, but so far I'm pulling in way more channels that ever before and I just have the antenna leaned up over my fireplace. I'm confident I'll pull in several more channels once I get the antenna positioned on a window. Which leads me to the conclusion of my review. Overall, I am very, very pleased with your product. I would only offer one suggestion which I feel would make your product even more user-friendly. I feel you should offer a total of three different options regarding coax cable length. Why not offer a short option, a long option and a longest option. The reason I say this is that, I'm not going to be able to reach my window with the supplied coax cable provided, as I'm about 5 ft short and now I'll need to look into shopping on Amazon for some type of an extender. Otherwise, I'm still quite satisfied with your product and it was money well-spent, indeed!

I just got my HDTV antenna today.  Setup was painless and very simple. Just screwed the one connector into the coax connection and plugged the usb connector into my Roku tv. Simple.  Attached the adhesive to the back of my antenna and then stuck it up high up onto the wall about 10-15 ft from my window.  And then scanned the local channels. I am in the Detroit area. That's it! I got maybe 30+ channels ... Digital picture was either equal to cable & Netflix or better.  Now I realize the local cable provider was ripping me off.  You can't go wrong with this digital antenna.  Best money I ever spent for digital reception.  Highly recommend this product.

Taking the antenna out of the box, I noticed I was missing the ‘magic stickers’ that it said should be included to help hold it on the wall.  But, I had some painters tape, so I used it to secure the antenna to the side of my armoire that houses my television.  I was originally planning to use the provided USB adapter to plug the amplifier directly into my surge protector strip, but my TV was too far away from the surge protector for the amount of cord provided.  Thankfully, my TV had an open USB port, so I plugged the amplifier USB directly into my TV.  Setup was easy, scanned for available ‘air’ channels and the antenna immediately pulled in several digital channels crystal clear.  I’m happy with my purchase.

Easy to install and it just works! I tried a couple cheaper models and was only able to get about half of our available channels. We are close to our towers, but there are many obstacles in the way. This antenna picked up everything with 50-90% signal strength. The black was obtrusive so I painted it and it almost disappears on the wall above our 82" screen. For reference, the picture was taken from about 15ft away.

I just received this antenna. It was so easy to install that I have it up and running already. My cable bill took an unexpected large jump and I decided enough was enough. I found the perfect spot for this antenna in my window and am very happy with my purchase. I love that it came with an extra long cord so I could move the antenna around better (my tv sits in a corner, but the window is several feet away). In the area I am living in, having the antenna in the window gives the best reception. This was not possible with antennas I tried in the past, given their short cords. Also, it arrived much quicker than expected, which is great since I am "cutting the cord" so to speak, with cable television.

I purchased an HDTV antenna through Amazon for my new television. I wanted to explore how it would work and stack up with cable – which I rarely use – for giving me the local television I need.I live in the sticks and for a long time, without cable, we were unable to get any channels, even local news. Now with the HDTV antenna, I have three channels connected to popular networks and give local and national news, two public television channels, and several channels showing a variety of programming from DIY shows to legacy TV shows to movies. The picture is clear and the antenna is placed unobtrusively.

I bought this antenna after the $70 one I bought at another store failed to receive stations where I live. I didn't have high expectations when I ordered this one but since it was so inexpensive, I had nothing to lose! I was so pleasantly surprised when I scanned for channels and it said 29 were found! My antenna that cost three times as much only received 12! I have to be honest, when I received it, I thought it looked like a piece of plastic!  I couldn't imagine that it would actually work!  I'll never make fun of it again. Higher price definitely doesn't mean higher quality ! This antenna is wonderful and I would certainly recommend it to anyone.

I purchased this antenna for my elderly mother. She lives approximately sixty miles from the nearest commercial TV station and approximately eighty miles from the next closest one. This antenna receives her two closest commercial TV stations crystal clear with the antenna simply mounted on the wall behind her television inside the home. We are very pleased with the antenna and we consider it well worth the price paid. Thank you.

I live approx 38 mikes outside of Chicago line of sight, Tried to use this antenna in an upstairs bedroom. Well after re scanning the channels several times. Tried moving it all over the room.  I was able to scan a total of 36 channels. No difference in using the supplied amplifier, Of these only 2 are major network channels. The rest are either up to 5 digital channels of the same channel, non English speaking and or shopping channels. It does work however, it just didn't pick up the network channels I was looking to receive. The coax cable is not what I would consider sufficient to get a strong signal it's much too thin more like a charging cable for a phone.

I live in a rural area 45 miles west of St Louis, MO.  We discontinued cable due to outrages increasing cost.  Based on good reviews on Amazon we purchased your antenna.  At first I had the antenna located on an interior wall on the second story.  While I was able to get 27 channels, including CBS, ABC, and FOX, the signal would vary depending on the time of day.  I decided to try relocating the antenna in the attic.  What a difference!  I still get about 27 channels, but the signal and clarity are sharper and constant.  It now alleviates constant re-scanning.  Also your amplifier definitely is an asset.  Without amplification, I could only get-a weak signal for 6 channels.  I am totally satisfied with the antenna, and its simple installation.  The biggest benefit:  watching total free tv and saving  $960 a year on cable. I would like to have another antenna.

The wire  on my older but similar, yet UN-powered, antenna was severed, so I replaced it with this. Despite so-called amplification, my reception is significantly worse, in an otherwise identical setup.  This is the case both with my TV's built-in tuner, as well as that of an external tuner/dvr device. Yes, I've plugged it into the USB port on my TV for power, etc. but no help. Can't properly pick up a station with a transmitter just 10 miles away (no problem for my old antenna).I've patched up the wire to my old unit, and it performed better already just lying on the bed, prior to installation in  place.

I live in a 290+ unit condo community in a heavily populated area of southwest Houston, Texas.  I imagine with some much "stuff in the air" it is a reason why I have had poor reception here.  Having 'cut the cord' years ago, I have tried a number of HD antennas of various price rages.  This is the first one that, so far, has not yielded anything but pristine reception with NO pixelated images.My first review, which was negative, is unsupported, and when I find it I will delete it.  The negative review was based on my inability to attached the coaxial cable, so I really had not given the device a fair chance.  I have no idea why I had difficulty the first time, but when I decided to revisit the issue, I easily connected the device.  With a thousand apologies to the seller and the maker of this device, I offer this 5-star review for price and performance outcomes.  This is also a lesson to me (and others, perhaps), to reign in knee-jerk reactions and take a deep breath before shouting THERE'S SOMETHING WRONG HERE!

I  purchased the HDTV antenna to replace the outrageous cable bill I was receiving every month and I couldn't be happier!  For no cost to me, I am able to watch the morning news and other local programs.  The instructions say to hang the antenna as high as possible and I did not do that--I have it resting just above my tv on the wall (that's where I can reach without a ladder) and after the initial channel search, I have 220+ channels.The antenna is super lightweight and easy to move around to find just the right location to receive input.
ProsItem delivered on time

I purchased an amplified antenna at Walmart for about $30, took it home and set it up.  I played with it trying at least 10 locations/heights/directions, rescanning each time.  It wasn't bad, I got 28 channels, most of them had 3 or 4 bars out of 5.  One thing that bothered me was the coax cable was too short, it limited where I could put the antenna and the antenna itself was boxy and thick.On a whim I decided to try this one and I'm glad I did.  Because this antenna is so much lighter, I was able to use painters tape to temporarily attach it to the wall.  The coax is much longer, which gave me more options for where it can go.  Right away I got 40 channels, and all of those previous 28 channels were 4 or 5 bars.  Best of all, it was less money for a better antenna.  I'm so very pleased.

I have had this antenna since January 2020. It's now July 2020 and no matter how many times I scan and rescan, this won't provide more than 2 or 4 channels. I don't really understand based on research all these stations are under 20 miles away and pretty much the same with a true heading of 88.71 to 88.93 degrees. Yet it receives some UHF channels and not other VHF channels like ABC, CBS. It occasionally surprises me and picks up NBC which is VHF.  Even with PBS new frequency spectrum for Philadelphia, it won't pick up that station. Stay away from this product. It is NOT consistent or dependable. A waste of money.

I got sick of my cable service (cox) upping my rate every other month - my basic cable didn't get me much other than the major networks (some we watch) and a few worthless local channels - I didn't care because my wife and I mostly stream - just trying to keep my bill low as possible -I decided to cut the cable and just keep the internet service - so I bought this indoor antenna for the networks -  the HDTV antenna had many excellant reviews, so we gave it a try -

I ditched my local cable company nearly 6-months ago because the price kept going up and up.  I purchased an Amazon product to help with TV shows but gave up my local TV stations and news.  Finally, I decided to buy this antenna and see what I could pickup.  I'm just north of a major city in the southeast and about 90 miles from another.  I was able to get 29 channels, including ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX and a few others that I am not too familiar with.  For the cost of less than $30, this is great!  For a one-time cost, this is a great solution and easy to install, set-up the channels on your TV, etc.  Loving it now for about 4-weeks!Ok, yes!  I gave up the other 100+ channels, but let's be real!  How many different channels do we watch at one time?  I propagate about <10 channels and watch one at a time.  There is nothing on that I care to watch 99% of the time anyway.

I've had my new antenna for almost a month now as I waited a bit before submitting my review. I've had no issues with the antenna at all. I got a very good signal from the start. I didn't need the amplifier as I did mount it on the bedroom window where my TV is located. Haven't experienced any channel signal issues since. The instructions are included and easy to follow and include a website where you can go and punch in your zip code to confirm what channels and signal strengths you can expect to receive as well as see the mileage distances to the towers closest to you.  I found the website for channels expected and map locations to nearest towers helpful. Although the site listed is no longer showing information, there is a link on that page that will redirect you to the new page location. So that was easy and found that I should get excellent signal. Packaging was good as well, instructions easy to follow. My only wish is that the provided adhesives were stronger, and or a few extras included. Some of them fell off the next day and I didn't have enough to remount the antenna securely. So I used clear packing tape instead. Make sure the surface is clean first to get the best out of the adhesives which is what I did not do first. It’s not a deal breaker and the lack of extra adhesives doesn’t affect my rating one bit. I’m very happy with my purchase and love watching tv without paying for cable.Setup was quick and easy. I got all the expected channels and a strong signal on my first try. You just plug in the End of the antenna cable to the back of your tv, mount the antenna in your window or as high up closest to the ceiling as possible, scan for channels from your tv settings and you’re done! If your location is further away from the broadcasting towers there is an amplifier included. But I didn’t need it. You’ll know if you need it if your picture isn’t strong, they are choppy and or you are missing channels.

My Gesobyte Antenna arrived today. I bought it because my roof mounted antenna does not have an outlet in my office and I wanted to connect my Smart TV to the OTA HDTV channels.I followed the set up instructions which was easy to do. I did not have a window facing the TV transmitter, so I installed the antenna on an interior wall in my office that does face the transmitter. There is an interior room, the exterior wall of my house, and the house next door between the antenna and the transmitter 16 miles away. I gave the antenna a 50% chance of working. Well, I was surprised when it worked perfectly! After the channel scan, I had every one of the 57 channels that are available. Not only that, but the picture quality was outstanding and the audio clear and sharp. This antenna signal is as good as the roof mounted antenna that has an unobstructed view to the transmitter.

I'm just writing to give you my feed back on this product.  I made this purchase to try and get some of our local TV channels outside of paying for it and I have to say im pleasantly surprised at how easy and quickly this antenna worked.  It was easy to setup even with the amplifier and although it's distance it's limited the picture is clear on well recieved channels and provides me the opportunity to get some  of my local stations.

Let me start by saying that I am 12 miles from Indianapolis, a city with all of the major stations. One would think I would be able to get them all without the amplifier, no problem. This is not the case. Without the amplifier, I lost 11 channels, one was the CBS range and another was the ABC range. But about the sensitivity of this product... At first, we put the antenna up in a sweet spot. It worked beautifully, 33 channels and they all came in crystal clear. (This was with the amplifier.) However, when I switched over to the FireStick, the tv started shutting itself off every 10-15 seconds and the FireStick wouldn’t respond to the remote. Thinking the amplifier might be the culprit, we took it off and lost the 11 channels. Thus began the hour-long saga of moving the antenna around, trying it with and without the amplifier, moving the wire around, everything we could think of, short of having my husband stand by the tv holding the antenna. It really seemed to like it when he held it. Eventually, we put it back in the original spot. Only, now it didn’t work there anymore. As long as my husband was near it, we could get all of the channels, but as soon as he walked away, *poof* the 11 channels were gone. Also, the wire is not well insulated, so it was open to any and all interference. For instance, we cannot have the lamps near the TV on while watching tv, because they make the signal break up. Another example, it would work fine with the wires on the front side of the lamp, but if we tried putting it behind the lamp (whether the lamp was on or not), it would lose channels. But the craziest of all was when my husband tried tacking the wire out of view, there’s this one wall that it apparently hates. If the wire was touching said wall, we got no signal. None.We finally found another sweet spot and the antenna is working beautifully again. No issues with the FireStick. (I don’t know what that was about.) Now, we are afraid to touch it, though. Honestly, if we decide to paint this room, I’m thinking we’re just going to paint over this sucker.

We recently moved from central PA to the southwest Florida area. In PA, we had a basic cable/Internet connection with an expensive and pathetic number of channels provided. Briefly, we had a few major stations, with the rest mostly religious, shopping, or required local access, for a total of 22. Mostly we just viewed the major stations, which we could also pick up via OTA. The reason we never just went with OTA was due to the cable franchise, as with other areas, having a strangle hold on everything, so they can do what they want and charge what they want. Once we contacted them and inquired about dropping the cable and just using them for the Internet. The cable company told us it was a "bundled package", and if we dropped the cable and only used them for Internet, they would charge us MORE than we were currently paying for both, as we no longer would have their wonderful "bundled package" !Now that we are in Florida, I did not want to repeat the same mistake of having an Internet provider's "bundled package". I was also told by a friend here the cable provider has just pushed a large cable increase onto their customers...imagine that. As I said before, I had tried a OTA in PA. It is a fairly expensive flat antenna stating with a "W". I connected it to our TV, now in Florida, and was please at the number of channels we can now receive without being under the cable company's thumb.

We are in the process of cutting the "Cable Cord". We tried several HDTV antennas and could not get the results that we wanted. I ended up buying the "U MUST HAVE" ultra-thin HDTV Antenna from Amazon. It worked perfectly and was a breeze to set up. This device provided a picture that was better then the cable!

Our cable TV went out recently for five days, and thankfully, months before that I had purchased this GB HDTV Antenna in preparedness for the hurricane season.  I connected the GB HDTV Antenna to my cable tv connection on my LG TV and completed the hookup following the clear and accurate instructions included in the box. I have a USB port on my tv connections input panel and, for added convenience, I connected the GB HGTV USB power connector into it. There is a transformer included in the box for a wall plug-in, but for my hookup, there was no wall plug connection needed.
