I then placed the antenna panel in a window and completed an on-air tv channel scan and to my great surprise, I was connected to 59 on-air channels and most of them were as clear HD as my cable picture TV was and without the iffy display of other on-air antennas that have to be moved for better reception every time the channel is changed.My wife and I are very pleased with the picture and sound provided with our GB HDTV Antenna and highly recommend it to all.  If necessary, you can even replace an old rabbit ears antenna for a much better tv experience.  Thank you, K & S
Cut the cable cord about 6 yrs ago. Have missed local news and needed to remedy.I'm happy to say its good, so far. Antenna hardware is easy to set up with included setup directions.

So far, there is nothing that I dislike about this Antenna.  In fact, this is the best Antenna I have ever purchased for in the house.  We have had so many issues trying to get all of our channels to come in on our TIVO.  We have bought 5 different Antennas over the past couple of years, and this is the best Antenna out of all of them.  It is also one of the less expensive.  Right away, as soon as I plugged the Antenna in and turned the TV on, all of our channels showed up.  I didn't even have to rescan the channels.  The picture that I attached is one of the channels that we were having the hardest time getting.  In fact, what is so impressive, is that at the time of the picture we had a lot of rain lightning and thunder and the picture never flickered.  This is just wow!!

This is a great quality product.  I highly enjoy this antenna and it scanned a lot of channels, and it was rather easy to set up.  I only had a bit of a dilemma with the external amplifier, which I ended up not needing since my TV wasn’t picking up any channels when connected via USB, but other than that it was rather straightforward.  I also like the little ‘magnetic’ adhesive at the base of the antenna sheet, which allows me to easily place the antenna at various spots on my window and relocate if and when needed whenever the signal is weak, without much of a hassle or a sticky mess.

I had low expectations for this antenna. As the Superbowl is coming and I don't pay for an expensive cable service, I hoped this antenna could get me the Fox 11 channel and I could watch the game on Sunday. The setup is fairly easy. I connected the coaxial cable to the back of my Fire stick TV and the USB power adapter to the electrical outlet. And I was ready to start a scan for channels. I didn’t bother to place the antenna close the  window because the coaxial cable provided isn’t long enough in my situation but I thought I could figure out something later. I just wanted to see if the antenna “worked’ and I could get some channels. To my surprise the scanning lasted about five minutes! I saw the scanning channels counting going for 10...20...30... until 132! I just couldn’t believe it! Still skeptical, I supposed the image quality wouldn’t be that great, but all the channels were crystal clear and all major networks were listed. My zip code is 92805 and I suppose others would get less or more channels but I highly recommend this antenna for those who don’t want to pay for cable. Now I can watch the Super Bowl!

I have tried numerous HDTV antennas over the last few years and NONE of them could do what this one does!  I live in Houston and have access to over 100 HD channels through the air.  I have obtained over 100 channels with a few different antennas, but only about half of them were watchable.  This antenna comes with a booster that is very near the end of the cord, near the tv.  This allows me to utilize the LONG cable to mount the antenna as close to an outside wall or window as possible. I pulled in 109 channels with this antenna, and over 95% of them were clear and stable.  I have pared the down to the 45 or so channels that I might enjoy, but every single major channel comes in clear and is stable, day or night, rain or shine.  I love this antenna!

I was hesitant and afraid to let go of the cable but the rates kept going up and most of the time we were watching netflix and Amazon Prime anyway.. When I read all these great reviews I was willing to give it a shot. A tech guy told me here in LA or any other big city you get a lot of the channels. Some times it's harder when you live in an appartment but single family is ideal. No need to buy an outdoor antenna and climb on the roof, this is much more simple.The antenna itself is just a thin piece of plastic. But boy does it work!!! I still can't wrap my head around it.All these hundreds of dollars we wasted with Dish, crazy! The only thing we haven't explored yet is how to record anything, might have to find our own DVR.

I am having issues with our local cable company (Spectrum) because it has serendipitously decided I did not live in a state/region (western Wisconsin) where I should get our local football team (Packers). Rather than adding one more regional station to their worthless and blank channels they just don't show anything, or they give pat cookie cutter responses back when queried.Enter this digital antenna. Now I can get our football games for the cost of the antenna and it is (in my opinion) clearer than some of their stinking signals on some of their other comparable channels.

We ditched our satellite tv provider recently and have been satisfied with the basic streaming services (Netflix, Hulu, Prime TV) but didn’t want to miss out on football season. This antenna had great reviews and was a good price. Install was extremely easy, just took it out of the box and plugged it in. I like that it has the option of running on USB port for power. We were able to plug it into USB port on our tv so no need to take up another wall or power strip outlet. We get more channels than I anticipated, which is great. If you have an HDTV then all you need is this. I live in Washington state, about 45 min north of Portland, OR for reference.

Having just moved to a rural area in North Central Florida I can get sat. TV service but I needed local stations to keep up with the local news, PBS and especially local weather.Hooking it up was a breeze and I immediately went onto my Roku TV, found Antenna, a few clicks later, I had 12 channels in this area.

My HD antenna was super easy to install and I am more than happy with the picture quality. I live in an area where the reception is "spotty" and because of that I had been using a "bundle" which included satellite television, VOIP telephone and internet.  After the expiration of the first year's discounted price I was forced to call my provider in an attempt to negotiate a more reasonable price. I had made do with sporadic television reception whenever it rained but the the "straw that broke the camels back" was the inability of my provider to rectify a telephone issue and yet another price increase.I have cut the cord, or more appropriately, I have removed the garrote wire from around my neck! I have cancelled my overpriced satellite television and inoperable telephone. With the money that I am saving a very nice vacation is in order. Thank you, thank you for providing a solution to my dilemma!

When I got this I thought someone forgot to include the antenna, all I got was a flexible piece of plastic, attached cable, and the little booster. I was wrong, and pleasantly surprised. Hooked it up, hit scan for channels, and got 43. I live in rural Kansas, nearest transmitter is 45 miles away. I used to get 20 with rabbit ears, and many were dependant upon weather. I've only had this a short while, but in Kansas we get all kinds of weather in short time spans. Been through clear and sunny, rain, clouds, snow, and sunny again. All the channels remained stable. Amazing.

I live in OC 70 miles from the transmitters in LA on top of Mt. Wilson, and I can see Mt Wilson out the windows that face the TV in my living room. In short a perfect situation for an amplifier. However like every other amplified antenna, I get more channels with OUT the antenna. This is a large antenna, so it works better than others, but buy the version without amp

I purchased this antenna after having compared costs to other antennas at big-box stores. I wasn't about to shell out $50-$60 for an antenna, so I went with this one. I like that it matches my window trim . The coaxial cable is plenty long enough to reach my TV from the window 12+ feet. The amp is powered via USB, so that can connect to your TV, or via the wall adapter. This antenna easily had no problem pulling in all my local channels, some of which I couldn't pull in with my old antenna. Overall I'm happy with my purchase. You just can't go wrong for the price.

Because I refuse to pay for cable; I've tried several antenna types over the years, and they all could only tune in a few channels really well and the rest were barely there. That is until yesterday when I installed my new Amplified HDTV. 60 seconds of plugging in the provided cables and positioning the antenna and I instantly had all the basic channels. I set the the TV to scan and it found almost 50 more. When you install yours be sure to keep it away from metal and don't be surprised if you have to move the antenna once or twice before you set it and forget it.Mr. Shin, Teacher
Hello,I want to share our experience with our HDTV ANTENNA.

I was able to connect to local TV in less than 15 minutes and I have a better connection in an apartment than I had with local cable. (cable was interfering with cable to make me pay more).  This is a great product and the selection of TV shows is great for families and seniors trying to save on cable and get back to basics. I highly recommend this product.  Full disclosure my apartment faces north towards major city where I am 30 miles away. I have a under $300 HD smart TV and I attached the antenna to the  to the sliding door window, I cancelled cable tv just use the antenna now. I have to say this is a awesome  and has worked perfectly daily

I was so doubtful this product could live up to the reviews but I was totally wrong!  This is super easy to install, giving me a perfect picture that blew me away.I am now able to disconnect high priced packages that drain the budget .  With this wonderful find, I get so many crystal clear channels...for free!

Doubted but now believe.  Placed next to TV and got 9 channels.  Raised above TV and got 15.  The reception was iffy in both locations.  That's when I threw the antenna and cable up and onto the second floor walk over.  The antenna drapes over a half wall, railing facing a 3x4' window.  Scanned again and got 63 channels!  The alphabets and Fox come in perfect.  The pictures look much clearer than what they were with Dish.Watched Sumo wrestling Friday night.  Only problem now is finding out why my wife knows so much about Sumo wrestling!

When this HDTV antenna was delivered and I took it out the box, there is a 1 2 3 step and you are set, it's that easy. Program it and you get so many channels. I put mines in the living room window, and pick up even more channels. Its great everyone should have one.PS. After 3 months with this product. This antenna is sold by Abask Tech, yes it was easy to install, but you will have to move the it around the room from time to time to get a better reception. Doesn't work very well when it is thundering or raining very hard. And don't believe the company ( Gesobyte - Abask Tech ) when they add or send you a card saying how you can get a free antenna just by, sharing your experience on there email address, which is extra.hdtv@gmail.com, don't believe them. I never received one. But I guess ask with any antenna you are going to have your problem.

This is by far the best antenna I have used.. I bought a different brand a couple weeks ago that was a lil less expensive,  but absolutely horrible, so I returned it and bought this.. I was still a bit skeptical but when I plugged it in, (which is basically all you do it's super easy to set up), I was more than pleasantly pleased. I haven't had any issues with pixelation nor gotten ANY "no signal" messages...I'm so glad I found this brand super happy with it...  You can't go wrong with this one!!

Just wanted to do a review about my HDTV Antenna that I ordered in February from Amazon. Wow!  I received my 4K antenna the other day.  The installation took seconds. I very likely will drop my very expensive cable package.  In addition, one of the best channels on cable TV is the Decades channel, which my new antenna picks up at no monthly charge!  Amazing!  I have been telling my friends about this terrific value for those who have had enough of the ever increasing cost of cable programming.  I should have ordered this antenna long ago.

Boy this is one great antenna! According to FCC I would be lucky to get 8 channels with an HD antenna. I plugged this baby in and WOW! I got over 60 channels of just about anything you can imagine. Got a recommendation from a friend and a gift suggesting that I purchase the (pictured) 200 Mile Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna. What a Find! This excellent product arrived within 24 hours and more importantly iin time for Thursday night football.Upon cutting the cord with a recent move I was caught flatfooted as football started and I didn't have local channels.  Gesobyte stepped in with an outstanding product.  It took me less than 5 minutes to pick the best spot for the antenna and connect it to my tv and voila my football night was saved!

It works for me!!! I get more “buffering” from my Spectrum app than from this antenna! (The buffering is extremely rare!)I am enjoying this antenna very much. I have it in a room on the first floor of my house, in my home office, and the window is facing another house, which is probably only 10 or 12 feet away. When I first set it up, I thought this would probably not work, because the next door house would block the signal! And at first it was buffering quite a bit, so I kept moving the antenna. After just 3 different locations, it started working very well, and I have been very pleased with it! Now I just need a couple more for my other TVs!

I purchased two of these for televisions in different areas of the house. They were easy to install and work like the old rabbit ears antenna, but more powerful. I only cared about networks, like ABC, NBC, etc. I live about 20 miles from downtown St. Louis and this antenna recognizes about 30 channels on any given day. The networks are clear, hi-def.Installation requires a bit of understanding of your television's capabilities. Both my tv's are smart and it was easy to find the setting to switch to this antenna rather than another source. Then, the tv has to search for available channels, which takes about 5 minutes. Then, you can start changing channels and watching tv.

We just signed up to Dish, and I was shocked to discover that the local channels didn't come in the basic package. When I called about it, the tech advised that I just buy an antenna, $20 or $25 is all it would take to get the local channels and because we had free 6 months extended service plan when we signed up, if we needed help installing it, they would come out and do it for us.So we ordered this and followed the simple instructions, but still needed help. When the tech came out, he had a series of adapters  to choose from, and the adapter cost us an extra $48, but that saves us $12 a month to get the local channels, and it works on all four TV's in the house, plus the channels channels show up on the guide, so we are happy.

Unbelievable!! I absolutely love this antenna!  Way better than the more expensive ones that I have purchased in the past. "  Because, I am now getting more stations with this antenna than I do with cable.  PLUS there are more stations that I actually like versus what was available on my basic cable.

I’ve got this antenna to replace an existing amplified antenna that I currently have. There were channels like NBC that I was not getting with my old antenna. We absolutely "LOVE" the Free HDTV Antenna! We live in the country, and satellite is the only option for television. However, satellite can get pretty expensive when you have a different receiver for each room. I ordered this antenna from Amazon, it arrived quickly, and I had it installed in less than 10 minutes! Our guestroom now has about 48, perfectly clear channels. When our kids and grand kids are visiting, they can now watch their own shows in the guestroom. They are perfect for putting in the motorhome/RV, etc. as well. I highly recommend the Free HDTV Antenna!

I recently cut the cable cord which was terminated on Feb 1st.  I had ordered this digital indoor antenna from Amazon but had not hooked it up.  Then it was suddenly February 2nd, Super Bowl Sunday.  I was so used to the cable being attached, it didn't dawn on me until around 10 minutes before the game that it wasn't.  I quickly hooked up the antenna to my 60" TV. I could have sworn my cable HD was still attached, but it was only this antenna that was producing the sharp image.I'm going to order two more of these antennas for other TVs in the house. This antenna is amazing! My cable rates were recently increased again and my bill was almost $250 a month. This of course is included Internet and phone service, but is still ridiculously expensive. When I called the cable company to try and negotiate a lower bill, the gentleman that was helping me told me that since I have been a loyal customer for 30 years, I had actually been a customer longer than he had been alive. And they still could do nothing to lower my bill. I took a leap of faith and get rid of my phone service and my cable boxes and tried this product. I was completely shocked by the amount of channels I get and the amazing picture quality. I am kicking myself for not doing it sooner, and I’m extremely happy that I finally did it. I am telling everyone I know about this antenna.

Bought this package mainly for the inline amp but for the money, the antenna came with it. I have a roof antenna that needed the amp but decided to play with the one included. I live in a valley and just stuck it on a window on the first floor to try it out. Totally surprised to receive 22 channels. Entire hook up took less than 5 minutes. Pictures crystal clear and, while I do have Youtube TV which gives me the big 4 networks from Philadelphia, I get all the locals in addition to some distant ones. Quite pleased. Going to put this up in the attic and combine with the roof antenna to see what happens.
I was skeptical .I hate paying for TV !

Due to expenses I had no choice but to cut the cable cord. This was a very unenthusiastic decision to make. I thought I’d never get decent tv again. The kids took this the hardest. We went for a awhile with fuzzy broadcasts of a few channels. It was stressful. I decided to give this antenna a try since it could be connected indoors and had decent reviews.I am AMAZED at the reception this HD TV antenna gets! Instead of getting a few fuzzy channels, I was able to find exceptional airplay for LOTS OF THEM. What a relief.

We received the antenna two days ago and set it up last night. The instructions were a cinch. 1, 2, 3 and we had it working. Plugged the amplifier into the power source on a power strip, screwed the coaxial cable into the antenna plug it the back or our really old Samsung 47 inch TV. Went to settings, set the selector on air/DTV on ours, and ran the setup program. It scrolled through and detected 21 channels and off we went. The picture on most channels is more High Def then cable for sure. Really cool. We stuck the flat antenna to a window behind a curtain and we were done!Great product!! Would do it again.

This antenna was very easy to install, and came with any connectors you need, and simple instructions. We have used this antenna for over a month, and recommend you discover where your nearest tower is on google maps, face your antenna toward it, by a window and high up if you can. It may take a couple of channel scans, but this is working perfectly for us, even in a multi-unit building in an urban setting.

I do like this antenna.  It has a long cord, so the antenna can reach towards the window or wall.  In addition, it has an amplifier in line which is being powered by USB on the TV which is convenient, because I don’t have to plug it in (it did come with a plug adapter if you need it).  In addition, it is working in line with an additional amplifier which I already had.  It is getting in channels from about 20 miles away and it is doing a better job than the rabbit ears that I had.  I am happy with this product, and the purchase that I made.  I would like a longer cord, but overall, i am satisfied.

I needed an indoor antenna (outdoor isn’t an option for me) and was concerned that the only window I could attach the antenna to faces the woods. I decided to try this affordable one before springing for a more expensive antenna. I’m so glad I did! It was very easy to hook up and I was pleased to get 39 channels! After having it a few days, I lost my PBS channels and some of the main channels (ABC, NBC) started getting glitchy. I contacted customer support, who replied very quickly. After repositioning the antenna (the stickers still worked after moving it a few times) & rescanning, I got my channels back. There are still the occasional glitches, but overall, the picture is better than cable and I get to watch the network shows I like, plus local news. Bye, bye cable!

I checked the government website to see what channels were available in my area. It came back zero. I have plaster walls but decided to try it anyway. I attached to the wall, set the signal for long range and scanned. I immediately received 27 channels. Moved it again and I have 38! Picture quality is as good as cable. I’m so glad I purchased this item.  There are a lot of channels I don’t  care about even when I had cable but at least I can now watch local news and get the weather. If I could attach to a window I bet I’d have more channels but I love how discreetly it’s hidden behind my Samsung 4K TV. This is a must for cable cutters.

I really like this antenna, and I believe it works for my application because we are within 30 miles of the towers.  I'm not sure if it would work for much more.  I will say that the coax is definitely not long for our house, but I was able to get a connector to connect an additional 20 ft of coax.  Since the towers are Northeast of our house and we have a brick house, I located the antenna in our small frame addition.  When I did that, we now have more than 50 channels.  I would recommend with antenna for thirty or so miles, but I cannot vouch for a greater distance.

I bought this antenna to use in my guest room for the 43" Philips 4K/HDR TV. The superior performance was immediately apparent. I ended up moving it to my main TV (65" Philips 4K/HDR) since it was better than the ONG antenna I had on it. The unique flexible design offers some interesting mounting options. I used the provided velcro strips to attach it to the back of the TV. This also pulled in the lower stations (channel 3-1, 3-2 and 3-3) that the other antenna didn't pull in..Great Product!! Great Vaiue!!

I recieved my antenna a few weeks ago. I was excited to hook it up and see if the reception promised was true. I was greatly disappointed when I opened the package to discover it was a previously used item. Paying nearly $28 I expect to purchase an item that is NEW. Sadly, this has happened with other items purchased from Amazon. Looking at the ad on Amazon again, I have to be honest, I am not sure it's the same one. I wanted this one because it states that it was new updated for 2020 and had a range of 120+ miles. I went ahead and hooked it up to see what would happen. I already have one with a 50 mile range. This one does the same as it. I was wanting to hook up all four of my TV sets but now I am looking to purchase from someone who will not send out previously used (returns) to customers who are expecting a new item for their money. $28 dollars may not be much for some but for others, it is.
I almost didn't purchase the antenna because of some of the bad reviews that it had.I decided that I would take a chance. I am sure glad that I did. When I first hooked it up I could barely get

I tried four other antennas prior to coming across this one.  The others all failed to bring in all the channels available in my area. This one gets them all and with no interference whatsoever, crystal clear. One very minor drawback.  This antenna comes with 18 feet of cord, which is great; but in my particular case I could have used another three or four feet.  Fortunately, I already had an extension cord and adapter, which gave me the extra length I needed and worked great.  Save yourself the trouble of trying other brands and get this one to begin with!

I just received my Gesobyte antenna and installed it.  Installation was just as expected by plugging the USB cable into the back of my TV for power and screwing in the coaxial cable to the back of the TV, done! My new TV had very little information on setting up my local channels with an actual antenna, so I checked the instructions that were included in the Gesobyte antenna's packaging and it explained what I should be looking for on my TV setup screen.  Once I found that, a click or two later is was scanning for channels and found over 100 channels that I didn't have before! I still have cable access on this second TV, but will be cancelling that shortly!  Outstanding quality product, easy setup and installation with cable quality picture, without the cable costs. Love this Gesobyte antenna!

Let me tell you, we ordered two other ones that were more expensive.  They don't come in or work as clear and as good as this one does!  I was pleasantly surprised.  It was extremely easy to install with great directions.  It even came with sticky dots for the different parts.  I was so excited when I could get 20 channels and we are almost 20 miles from the main town.  They come in crystal clear!  There are no interruptions and no freezing screens.  I get all of the main channels, ABC, NBC, Fox, etc.  Thank you so much for making a great product!  I will definitely refer you to my friends and family

I purchased this antenna because I was having major issues with my former cable provider. I was  a bit skeptical because I had never used a digital antenna before. I was shocked when my television looked better than my cable TV!! The channels were clear, vivid, and had a beautiful color due to the HD !! One thing I did dislike which may be due to my area was that there were some channels that were not spoken in my language but it was well worth the money for the quality and the channels which were about 60+ total for my area. The stations that I did catch were great!! Honestly, if it was not for my family loving cable I would ditch the cable bill and stick to this !! Great buy!

What a great product!I wanted to get some local channels for the basement theater TV in case I ever wanted to browse my local channels and watch local sports on top of all the streaming options that are now available.

I installed my Gesobyte HDTV Antenna today that I ordered from Amazon.  It was the highest rated and review HDTV Antenna on Amazon and for good reason!  I have purchased other HDTV Antennas in the past and I have been disappointed.  I even bought separate signal amplifiers, but with the Gesobyte HDTV Antenna I got a clear picture for every station available in my area the moment I turned on my television.  The picture quality is amazing.  It comes built in with a signal amplifier with two modes, short and long range!  This is a great HDTV Antenna.

I bought my antenna from Amazon in February with little hope that it was going to work.  I inherited my mom's flat-screen TV which is not a smart TV.  I tried to connect it with NetFlix and my Amazon firestick, but not even the USB port would work with anything. Not my laptop, not my smartphone.So it seemed like I was going to be stuck with a TV that I couldn't use and I didn't want to pay my satellite tv company more money for a TV that doesn't get watched enough to justify the cost. My brother-in-law was telling me about an antenna that he bought that had a flat black panel on it and it was able to get him several local channels for free.

So I'm trying to "cut the cord" since cable TV has become an expense I can no longer justify.  This antenna was easy to install.  Literally the hardest part was figuring out my TV remote to re-scan for air channels.  When I finally figured it out I had over 100 channels.  All the locals that love and crystal clear.  Why do people pay for cable TV?  I mean yeah there are some cable channels that I'd like to have but my cable/internet bill jumped to over $220/mo.  By time this is over I'll have everything I needed before for less than $100.  It's not as instant as turn on the TV and see a picture, but the inconvenience is NOT worth $1500/year.

Since I'm not very technical, I had reservations about installing this antenna by myself.  I should not have been concerned at all.  I moved my television into my second bedroom, followed the instructions, and the next thing I knew I had over 50 channels I could watch without cable.  The setup itself just took a few minutes - pretty much plug and play - it took a little while to go through the television set up to find all the channels (because there were a lot).  I live about 5 miles from the tower.  The picture is perfect.  I am very pleased and will recommend this antenna if anyone ever asks me for suggestions about antennas.

We purchased the antenna for a spare bedroom that is not used often, so we wanted to get a television that we did not have to pay for extra cable. The unit was set up very easily. It got us about 33 channels that we did not get before. It works perfectly for a spare guest room.

It's really easy to setup but you have to test around if you need the amplifier or not so that took me more time finding which is better.  I like that it looks sleek and doesn't get in the way like the rabbit ears.  I didn't attach it to the wall, there are few times when there's a skip in some channels and if I move it around it's fine.  They have a deal if you write a review then you get a free antenna once you send them the review.  It's probably why there's so many reviews for this.  It is the reason I am writing this review to be honest.  Overall it's easy to setup and works well and inexpensive so it's worth it.

Got this hd amplified tv antenna by Gesobyte thru abask on Amazon. I tried an outdoor roof mounted name brand model but it only got 3 channels mounted in the  peak of roof. We don’t live in a great reception area with mountains east & west of us. I tried this 2020 version hd amp Tv antenna at first laying on a table & didn’t get much. Then I decided to add 25’ of coax so I could put it on our sliding glass door (they recommend installing on window). It auto programmed 30 channels! Using the plug in adapter for the usb & enjoying local networks with clear picture, news, old movies & shows etc. Great antenna! Highly recommended, just try it on a window facing the towers if possible.

I received my powered HDTV antenna and was able to get it set up very quickly. I just plugged it into my TV and the power cord into my TVs USB slot, and set my TV to scan. I definitely noticed that this antenna was able to receive more channels than another, un-powered antenna I had from before. The higher I placed this antenna, the more channels I was able to scan for. So I’m very pleased with this one, and recommend it. The picture quality is excellent and it was convenient that they included a piece of adhesive so I could stick this to the wall behind my TV.

I have an old 43 inch flatscreen television in the basement. It is not hooked up to cable, and I wanted something for the grandkids to be able to watch. I Purchased this antenna hoping it would get me at least four or five channels. Oh my gosh. It worked great even in the BASEMENT.  I was able to get 16 channels with it. I had a coax cable that ran from the basement up to the living room, so I hooked The coax to the back of the television and took the antenna upstairs to the living room and placed it in the window. Now I get 25 channels. All crystal clear. Twice as good as I ever expected it would be, and 10 times better than the old antennas. Thank you so much. I’m very satisfied with my purchase and the price was great. It was super easy to install. It uses the USB power from the back of your television set. I have never been happier with an Antenna purchase

Let me start by saying I had a very cheap antenna that was included in another product.  It wasn't good at all.  Signal quality of various channels varied constantly.  I eventually got reasonable reception when I hung it outside a window (silly thing to do).  I was gone for a few days, and when I came back the wind had ripped the antenna off the coax.  Funny thing is, the bare coax wire worked better than when the  antenna was connected.So, I got this one.  Connected it (left it indoors) and ran a channel scan.  I now have several new channels I didn't have before (80 in total), and with excellent signal quality.  There is only one channel that isn't great.  But it is located in South Carolina (I'm in Brooklyn NY).  I don't want to watch that channel, I'm just amazed I receive it.

I have been a 40 year cable subscriber but grew up in a household with a roof antenna. I finally decided to make a break from the constant growing cable bills from my local provider. With online streaming TV available I needed an alternative for my local channels in order to view local news but mostly for my local sports teams. I did some investigating online regarding local air wave availability since I'm 30 miles south of the broadcast towers in Seattle, I wasn't sure what I could receive? I had previously bought a digital antenna that I had seen on TV but had no luck dialing in any quality channels as they advertised so I returned it. Without expectation I purchased a U Must Have indoor HDTV antenna, I hooked it up with out the booster and was surprised that I got 3 times as many channels as the other one I purchased. I was pretty excited and mounted it on the front window of my house and then added the booster in which I thought would make it even better. I auto-programmed my TV again and then tried it but found that many channels wouldn't come in. I was a bit frustrated as to why after adding the booster did I get worse reception? I pulled the antenna from the window and began moving it around the room to find the picture and the number of channels greatly improved! Seems the  reception for different channels can be improved with a little patience and some experimenting. Thanks to the long chord, I was able to find the "sweet spot" and now I'm thrilled with the picture quality and moved forward in cutting my cable dependency. I don't ever have to pay for local channels again and also have the ability to take it in my camper as well. I would recommend this antenna, if you are in a location similar to myself and want freedom from the cable monopoly. Thank you,  I found myself searching freely through the channels and it took me back to fond memories of my childhood.

I bought this specifically to get PBS at my parent's home (in the California Central Valley) which was 86 miles from that tower.  Tried many different locations in the house, including different rooms.  Tried different TVs.  Could not get that station.  I did get that station with my old Mohu and old Vizio TV from my kitchen.  So those were left at my parent's house.  I bought a new kitchen TV and with this antenna I get 92 stations.  I am 27-59 miles from the various towers.  Gave 4 stars because they advertise 150 miles and we definitely didn't get that.  Good product besides that.

So we currently have the ol' rabbit ears which we have had for a number of years now. Decided to upgrade to this new "earless" model. Installed this antenna in all of about 5 minutes. Upon first channel search we got loads of channels, same number as we currently have so I knew we weren't missing any. We didn't even mount the antenna- just laid it on top of the entertainment center. (Now I'm wondering if we would get more channels by mounting??). And I have to say, the picture is incredibly clear and brilliant. Very, very pleased with this upgrade.

We absolutely love our antenna!  We had one, bought one for my parents house and bought an additional for our house.  We live in a rural part of the country and we don’t have unlimited data for our internet.  This gives us the opportunity to save data for streaming and allows us to watch local channels and football for free!  We really have very few issues with signal and this antenna exceeded our expectations.  It is a must have for people who stream their tv!!!!!!!

I had a non-amplified antenna first, very similar in style, but didn't quite get all the stations.  I then purchased a much larger outdoor amplified antenna and it got all the stations, but every station was intermittent, including ones that were perfectly clear before.  Finally switched to this antenna and now I get all the stations perfectly fine.  Even with the amplifier off it does a better job than the first two antennas I tried, but it still needs the amplifier to get some of the further out towers.  This is a great antenna, and it comes with a nice long cord allowing for lots of placement options depending on needs.  Also great that it came with a USB power supply as I have another device already using the only USB port on the TV.

Changed from an old antenna that was 3 or 4 years old. Used to receive around 65-70 channels.  I am now getting 92 (a lot of which are spanish).  Picture quality on the HD channels that are broadcast are great quality, others are just so so, not to the fault of the antenna, just that those stations are not broadcast in HD. Installation was simple. Make sure you move the antenna around to find the optimal position. I'm in an apartment and could not get many channels mounting on wall. I have it on the sliding glass door.

I finally had the courage  to “Cut The Cable”. I purchase a different make digital antenna and installed it on one of my TV’s. With the exception of ABC, I was able to scan and get local channels but the reception left much to be desired. the pictures pixilated and would come in and out. I tried moving the antenna but nothing worked.I wanted to try another antenna for my 2nd TV.  I looked at the reviews on Amazon and this model was rated #1. It was an easy install and when I scanned for channels, I was in for a huge surprise. I got ABC and 69 other channels. The

Really an exceptional antenna for HD reception. Surprised how many channels it picks up in the Phoenix area here; way more than 30. Can vary between 45 and 60 depending on directional position of antenna. Also, it gets some oldies channels I cannot get with my Cox cable here, so I am keeping it. I'll just flip between the two, which is how I have it set up. I do enjoy my cable for the Discovery and other cable channels and will keep both. But, if your on a budget for a while, then you'll save big time canceling your cable and using this for free. Within the first two weeks it pays itself off.Enjoy!

The world of free tv came to us.  I have plans to remove cable at some point and really hoped that this would be a good answer for us.  We have been exploring several options, but local channels are the key.  All of them are available and very clear.Plugged it in, remembered to search channels and at first got about 40 but some were not as clear as expected. I moved the antenna to a different part of the wall and reset the channels, 61 DTV and all clear as HD can make them.

I am kicking myself for not purchasing this antenna earlier. The reception is fabulous, and I no longer have to pay a small fortune every month just to watch the local stations. I’m a senior citizen on a fixed income so this purchase has made a real difference for me financially. Thank you for providing such a great product.

This is great no more paying to watch TV and Commercials had just got a second TV for the Bedroom cable wanted $275 for a second hook up saw this antenna on Amazon and decided it was worth a try I get a great picture on all the local channels in fact i did not know we had this many off air must be at least 20-25 was up and running in 10 minutes the amp powers off the USB in so just need 1 outletget one you will save i wrote this and i approve this review

Bottom line: It is better than the 50mile rated antenna we had, good enough that we still don't need to pay for TV, but don't expect to receive the claimed 200 mile range.Just moved and the antenna we had (50mile rated) wasn't picking up any stations.  This antenna was the longest rated range available so tried it.  The antenna itself seems about the same, so probably just has a more powerful amplifier.  It is still very sensitive to weather and antenna placement (picked up about half as many channels in a window 5 feet away from where we finally left it, works better for us facing North/South).  Generally, it is picking up some Milwaukee stations clearly (37 miles away) and in clear weather some Chicago stations (50 miles away) although the picture and audio from Chicago tends to drop out frequently (they don't come in at all if it's raining) so I don't really consider those channels watchable.  Not really any hills or obstructions in the geography here so I would expect that to further reduce your range.

We're a cord-cutting household and watch ALL of our tv through apps (Amazon Prime, Netflix, HBO, Disney, etc.).  I'm a huge football fan, and the only problem with not having cable is that I can't watch local games.  Easy fix!  Get yourself the Gesobyte digital antenna and the problem is solved.  Now, not only do I have access to all the local games, we can now watch live tv with a large selection.  My antenna picked up 171 different channels.  Do yourself a favor, get rid of your cable bill and get yourself this antenna.

I purchased my HD Antenna from Amazon and very excited when I received it.The package came, I opened it and unboxed.  The only thing that was different was the instructions pictures of the parts included were different than the parts. But my antenna seemed newer than the instructions.
Hi there,Hope your whole team is doing well

Being in a major metropolitan area I have had issues in the past with receiving TV channels. I currently replaced a outdoor/roof mounted TV antenna because airplanes were causing issues with my TV signal when they passed over. I installed this TV antenna and plugged in the USB and I was happy to see that the channels appear as crisp as ever. So far so good on the airplanes passing overhead not effecting the signal of the channels either. I would highly recommend this to anyone in need of a reliable antenna. It also looks very sleek as well!

So this antenna advertises 120 mile range and that is completely bogus. I live just 17 miles from the TV towers and I can't even get a solid signal on the VHF channels. They constantly go in and out with a warning that pops up saying I have a poor signal. I placed the antenna in several different areas trying to get a good signal but it is impossible because the antenna is just too weak. The advertised 120 miles is just laughable and they should change the description to more accurately show it's real range which seems to be a maximum of 15 miles.
Picked up way more channels than I expected
Instructions were very clear and concise.  Installation took minutes.  We now receive 36 stations, including ABC, CBS and NBC.  Good product, lives up to expectations.

Great product.......does just what the manufacturer says it will. Very light weight. Just don't expect miracles if you can't get a proper positioning of the antenna.  We are 7.5 miles from the broadcast point; and, mounted the unit on the wall behind our 1st floor widescreen TV. We get the 4 local channels just fine.....especially at night. Getting 2nd one for a friend.

This is a great antenna! It literally took less than 10 minutes to set up. Once scanned, I have 99 channels and a great picture. I also appreciate the velcro tabs that are included-they allowed me to fasten the antenna securely high on my bedroom window for maximum reception. Awesome!

Having used previous flat screen antennas, I thought this might only be a slight improvement, but I was wrong!  This antenna is phenomenally great!  No need to attach to a window in order to capture stations, this one can be placed on a wall and does not rely as strongly on directional receiving.We are about 20 miles from Oklahoma City TV transmitting towers, and when we installed this inside of a room without directional windows towards the city, we mounted it on a wall behind the TV and the auto-select function of the TV picked up 42 stations, the bulk of which were Digital!  AWESOME!

The antenna system and its parts are well made, quality parts.  Even the box and enclosed instructions are well done in presentable English with useful images.  It took me only 15 minutes to set it up.  I placed the antenna in the window closest to my Samsung 4K TV.  According to the FCC tables, there are about 30 stations transmitting from locations up to 30 miles from me.  This antenna picked up all of them.  I am astounded, and happy.  I want to cut the cable cord and move on to streaming.  This antenna will make my plan that much easier and save me some money, too.

I did a Google search for the best TV antenna...this one came up every time & so I read the reviews & some were good, some were not.  It was more negative responses than I cared for but with the 120-mile reception, I had to give it an effort.  I am in a good area & can get up to 35-40 channels but nothing on this one.  I used the amplifier & did not use it on both TV's & nothing...didn't even recognize there was an antenna connected.I have hooked up multiple TV's for myself & family & can work my way around all the settings...I am just so disappointed as I was looking to be able to get more channels with the 120-mile reception claimed in the specifications of this antenna.  Thankful to Amazon, that I can return it & I hate to return anything.

My old antenna only found 13 channels. This antenna found 30. I didn’t even know most of the new channels existed. Throw in the fact that the picture looks a million times better and you can’t beat this deal.

This antenna is excellent.  I was only hoping to get a few channels but was suprised to get 18and I live in a rural area. Excellent picture quality.  Saving me over one hundred dollars a month. We getting rid of cable tv...cutting the cord!

I purchased antenna with an 18 foot coax cable, equipped with the versatility to position it on a highly receptive occasional table.  Now the Roku’s new antenna receives signal from several local stations, my finicky housemate stays entertained and rarely makes a sound, and I oft retreat to my study for hours on end without being found.  Sometimes, though, particularly after a strong thunderstorm, the signal does seem to shift, requiring me to adjust the antenna here and there just a little bit.  My old antennas did not receive nearly as good reception as this new one.  There are lots of old trees in my suburban-ish urban neighborhood, and I think I’m on a subtle opposite-facing slope… so it was difficult to find a really decent antenna and not lose hope.  I am quite pleased with this purchase, and will likely purchase a second.  At times I roguishly grin as I revel in this win, and thank my lucky stars for leading me to an antenna that feels no less than empyrean.My only consternation is that I purchased only one; for unlike my housemate, if I miss the evening news my day doesn’t feel done.  Nearly every evening he hogs the Roku with this great antenna after work, and sprawls upside down on my couch as if poised to perform a lazy man’s twerk.  I flee to the sanctuary of my study, hoping to avoid this eccentric buddy.  The old antenna and TV are there, but they haven’t much life to spare.

I really don’t understand all the great reviews for this antenna. I bought it based on the reviews, hoping to get better reception than the RCA antenna I got locally. Picture quality was similar and I still have dropouts but now I get 4 less channels than I did with the RCA. Tried several different locations in the house before mounting high in a window next to where the RCA was located as this gave me the most channels and strongest reception but still less than the RCA.

After dealing with fuzzy picture from an old "bunny ears" antenna for years, I decided to pull the trigger on getting one of these digital antennas. I was skeptical at first, which is why I put it off for so long, thinking it wouldn't be much better, but seeing as how many 5 star reviews there are, I decided it was worth a shot. The reviews aren't lying! Super easy setup, just connect a couple pieces together then plug into your TV and like magic the picture is crystal clear. I used to get only around 15-20 channels, but now I am seeing dozens that I didn't have before. Really great product, recommend!

The Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna Long 200 Miles Range - Support 4K 1080p is super easy to connect and reaches to the other side of the room if you need it that way.  It found 86 channels in my area, though I don't watch every one, but I am very happy to replace the one that would not work in the same place each day.  Also, the reception seems much clearer on all the channels.  I love the antenna shape because it can be placed behind a tapestry on the wall if you don't like it for decor, and it still works without adjustment!  A great purchase in my book!

If it weren't for my terrain, this would have been one of the best purchases I've made in awhile (I am in a bit of a valley).  Even with that situation, this antenna picked up dozens of local digital channels that I had no idea even existed in my area!  While not really designed for outdoor mounting, I tried raising it higher on a pole, just for grins, and it found 73 channels!  Had I not been blocked by houses on a hill between me and the city, I'd have gotten all those channels with this sitting in a windows.  Unfortunately, I need to move to a more robust outdoor antenna that I can mount on my roof, just because of my situation.  But, if you have a mostly clear path to your broadcast antennas, this indoor TV antenna will make the decision to "cut the cord" VERY easy.  Couple it with a USB tuner and software, and turn an old PC or your XBOX into a DVR/Streaming device for your home.

I received my Antenna a few days ago. The packaging was a slim profile, with all pieces neatly packed in the box. Contents included everything needed for setup as well as some materials for cord management and mounting. Setup was easy and I liked the option of drawing power from the tv with the usb cable or from wall outlet power. The channel search tool several minutes, a little longer than I expected at around 10 minutes, but the Antenna did pick up about 15 digital channels for my area I. Long Beach, MS. I moved the Antenna a little closer to the window and was able to pick up a few more after searching again. I think the Antenna would pick up more if I mounted it higher, but that wouldn’t look great with my living room setup. The channels that I did pick up come in very clear and provide a steady signal. Definitely recommend for the cost and quality.

I recently purchased this HDTV antenna to work with Sling TV. I received one from them that I didn’t realize only has a 30 mile range. I recently purchased yours and received 10 more channels for a total of 19. I finally got the channels I wanted. This is by far the best product I’ve purchased. This along with Sling has allowed me to save $100 a month because I dropped Direct TV.

The package arrived on time with no issues. Everything needed for setup was included in the package with clear instructions. There is a booster for those that live far from the signal sources which I didn't need for my location but it's nice they include the option. The cords were long enough to locate the antenna wherever you needed it as well. There is an option of up to 90 minutes of "DVR" if you use a HIGH SPEED USB stick (not included). I have no need for this currently so I didn't bother setting it up but its another nice feature.It was very easy to hook up and to program the channels. Took less than 15 minutes to find a location to mount it on the wall behind the TV and to program the channels. Included are permanent style adhesive pads to mount the antenna on the wall/window but I ended up using removable/ semi-permanent style adhesives to prevent paint damage when removed in the future.
Hi,I have purchase two of you HDTV Antenna's over the past several months and they are a great value!

Really eager to get rid of cable, I read through reviews (on Amazon and off) and am really surprised how bad the reception is.  I live in the DFW area and should be receiving strong signals, but the signals I receive with this HDTV antenna provide unsteady pictures and sometimes missing audio.  It's just not something I can watch without great frustration or nausea.  The item comes with a signal booster and with it on or off there is no difference to the audio/visual on my TV.  So I've got to find something else, because this particular product is just garbage and I don't believe all the "stars" is truthful.  Can't possibly be.  So purchase at your own risk.  This HDTV antenna, at least, is a waste of money.

I just got this today from Amazon. Installation was easy and it works flawlessly so far. I replaced an indoor digital antenna that is rated for 60 miles and it worked but tended to cut out quite frequently which is to be expected as are about 69 miles from the tower. This one has worked great!

Won't be as simple as it seems.. Not as advertised. Seller claimed that this antenna has '130+ Miles' range. Not true. It does not even see TV stations within 15 miles. I live in Fairfax in Northern Virginia. There are over 100 TV stations within 130 miles from me. Yet, this antenna receives only 14 channels total. It is installed by the window on the second floor, with no obstruction whatsoever. There are no hills, no tall buildings, and no mountains around here. And no tree obstruction either.  Yet, no matter the location of the antenna, it only receives no more that 14 channels.  The seller claimed antenna boasts 4K reception. Not true. I have 4K Ultra UHD TV.  Yet, most of the 14 channels are 480i; and about 3 are in 720p. The highest resolution it can receive is 1080i for two channels; not even 1080p, and not even close to 4K. This is deceptive advertising. Please stay away from this product!

I purchased my antenna from Prime to use expressly when my internet goes out so I can still watch tv. Using primarily Netflix, prime, and Alexa gives me limited access to regular tv shows and programming. When internet goes out, I have nothing. I am disabled and almost completely bed bound, so you can only imagine how important having tv to watch is for me.My son had it hooked up in only minutes, scanned the channels and I have access to sooooo many stations. I haven't even begun to explore my options but am very excited.  I even found out I can program Alexa to tune into this antenna so I just say tune into ABC and proof, I'm watching regular tv.  It's such a breeze.

We are trying to cut the satellite cord to save money and we can across you antenna on Amazon.  It was reasonable priced and the reviews were good.  We received it today.  Promptly took it out of the box to set it up.  It took less than five minutes to install.  We get 41 channels...for free!  we didn’t even know you could get some of these channels without having satellite or cable!!  We will recommend your product to our friends.

Very easy to install and setup. I immediately scanned for channels and got 31 digital channels with strong signals. I hadn't even positioned the antenna yet, it was just hanging behind the TV! I extended the cable and placed the antenna near the ceiling behind a door and scanned again for channels. This time I got 62 digital channels! Almost every channel is clear, with a strong signal. I found lots of very interesting programs, new and old. Great deal and even comes with a lifetime warranty.

Pro's...it's small and light, it works.Con's....even though it is amplified, it works no better for me than any other indoor antenna I have used.....I have a smart TV and do not watch over the air broadcast very often, but I like to have that option. We recently remodeled and it was going to be a lot of work to move my existing outdoor antenna coax to the new TV location, I had not tried inside antennas for several years after giving up on them a long time ago.....I was hoping that technology had improved.....nope....this does no better than the 4 non-amplified indoor antennas that I had tried and thrown in the garage years ago....pay no attention to the "milage" ratings.....unless you are in an elevated location or within 20-25 miles of the transmitter, if you want good performance you need a outside antenna.

I don’t have cable but stream services. I was missing local channels for specials (New Year’s Eve, awards shows, local news, etc.). I did not buy this to replace anything- if I had I would be disappointed. I bought it to supplement by streaming services and am very happy with it. I did not use the amplifier because I wanted to see if I would get the channels I wanted without the extra cords. I did! I wanted Fox, CBS, ABC, PBS and I got all of those plus a few extra random channels (NBC Golf anyone?). I was able to hide the majority of the cords which was important to me. Worth the investment!
I just installed the HDTV Antenna on my Phillips Roku TV.I really like that the TV already has a USB port on back to power the antenna.
Thank you for a great product.I bought your antennal through Amazon, as they were rating your antenna very high.

I was able to get so many channels then I was with little rabbit ears. I live on social security so I'm unable to subscribe to cable but there's no need to now I have it all this antenna is great and it was easy to set it up. I'm 82 if I can do it anybody can do it

Absolutely thrilled with this antenna!  We have been paying @$70.00/month for a subscription service with Live TV.  Except for football season (and, we can figure that out, easily), we only watch live tv once per day for the local news.  This antenna has now allowed us to cut that particular subscription streaming service by three-fourths, and has given us 52 local channels.  The picture is crystal clear, and we could not be happier.  We wondered why we hadn't tried this option a long time ago!

Like so many people today, we are searching to find ways to "cut the cord" in an effective and economical manner.  We initially tried an inexpensive and small antenna that was rated for up to 35 miles.  Since we only live about ten miles from the transmission towers in our area, we thought we were safe ... but no.  That particular antenna was only able to receive a very few stations out of the many that should be available in our area.Not wanting to give up, we continued to review our options.  That is when we found this antenna, which was listed as a "Best Seller" on Amazon.  This particular antenna was rated for 130 miles and included an amplifier.  We were pleasantly surprised at the ease of installation and station detection.  The antenna had no problems at all locating ALL of the stations available in our area.  The picture quality and audio actually surpasses that which we had received from our local cable company.

I have to say, I had some doubts as to whether this little antenna would be able to pick up much from the first story of our home, but it worked far better than I imagined. The instructions were clear, it took me maybe 10 minutes from unpacking to trying out different windows for the best reception and rescanning. The picture is really clear too! The only thing I would recommend to the manufacturer is to make it with a white cord, to blend in with the baseboards more. For the price and performance you can't go wrong with this antenna.

The instructions were super simple to follow and I had it connected in no time. The provided amplifier is nice and I like the fact it connects to a usb port on the back of the TV. I also appreciated the double sided tape to mount the antenna to the wall. I mounted the antenna to the wall after scanning with a few temporary locations until I was happy with the number of channels and signal, then stuck it to the wall. I am able to get 32 channels with this antenna where I can only get 7 with my attic antenna. This thing is awesome and you can't see it since it's low profile and hidden behind my wall mounted tv.

I had to add coax so I could place it in a window facing the Fox tower at around 60 miles. The other networks came in fine. It showed two bars like the other networks but the picture would freeze and voice would delay. It will do till Dish gets local Fox channel back.Now my wife can watch Kelly Clarkson on fox in the afternoon and I can watch the Super Bowl.

This antenna is outperforming the Clear HDTV antenna we purchased from Best Buy.  We were able to simplify tape the antenna to the wall directly behind our Samsung Smart TV easily reaching the input on our TiVO OTA DVR. The antenna is hidden behind the TV, making the installation much less unsightly compared to the Clear which stood on a small end table out in the open. However if you are required to mount it higher on a wall or window, there is ample coax length to reach your antenna input. We’ve tried several different HD antennas but this one is the best by far.

We recently got rid of our cable. We decided to get an antenna to get our favorite local channels so we can still watch our local tv. This antenna is SO EASY to set up and use. It took 7 minutes to scan channels and the instructions are very clear and easy to understand. It took me less than 12 minutes TOTAL and we had crystal clear local channels. 38 of them and some of them are cable channels! LolWe bought another one for our downstairs tv too. Great product! Easy to install. And VERY affordable. Will recommend to anyone who wants to the cut the cord!
I picked up my first HDTV antenna for my girlfriend's TV. I was reallysurprised how well it worked - both in terms of the number of channels

I was a little skeptical about purchasing an antenna for my spare TV. I am cutting the cord on cable. So, I was very surprised that I am able to receive around 20-30 local channels with clear viewable pictures and sound! No sudden lost of picture due to trees, clouds, buildings, storms, snow or interference! I am amazed! Very satisfied with the product and would recommend to anyone. It has a wonderful warranty, as well and it was so simple to setup!!

This is a really seamless and quick way to stream over the air and digital channels when you finally decide to "cut the cord." With short and long range settings, this antenna streamlines the process of getting the local and long distance channels to appear. An example is that I live in LA but also can get the local stations in San Diego.I was just hoping to get the basic channels but there are far more channels than I thought.

After a quick and straight forward installation I managed to obtain 37 channels (used the HDTV auto-scan) and some in HD (where available) of Prime Time Networks.  However, you will need to place antenna (with or without the included amplifier) on the window itself to ensure you obtain great signal. Otherwise, you’ll get pixelation due to weak signal indoors.This is perfect for someone who wants prime time and some cable channels WITHOUT needing the bulk of cable channels which you must subscribe for.  This is a one time installation and one time payment.

I gave this 2 stars because some channels are better than none. It picks up about half of the available channels no matter where I place it. I really only wanted the major 4 networks NBC, ABC, CBS, and Fox. I can't mount the antenna because I need to move in order to get some channels to work. This product definitely does not reach 80 miles and I don't recommend it if you live further than 30 miles from the signal towers. It might work better for you if you live closer to the network towers. One positive thing I will say is that the antenna itself is very sleek and easy to install. I have to move the location of the antenna almost every time I change the channel. It loses signal very easily too with light rain or someone walking by the antenna. Don't waste your money if you want a long range antenna.
very pleased with quality of product, allows for great reception even from underground/basement areas

Wasn't too sure if this antenna would work and help me cut off my cable company. I installed it on a 2013 Sony WEGA 60" LED TV and it works amazing. Small with a nice 18 foot long cable lead, easy to program, good reception when placed on my window. I was very impressed at being able to get all my local channels and further ones I never knew existed. 5 Stars and highly recommend this item to cut the cord from your local cable/satellite provider.

I live in an area where TV signals are not very strong between Chicago and Milwaukee.  Tried several different antennas with little success and signal is highly dependent on the weather.  Most neighbors have 40 foot towers to get TV signals, but live in an apartment and cannot do that.  Installed this last night and was amazed at the number of channels and signal strength.  It completely amazes me that something so small can perform so well.

The installation was very direct and straightforward, well illustrated, and completely explained.  I did the set up three different times and rescanned for channel signals each time to make sure that I was using the best setup for my particular situation.  We normally use a roof mounted high range digital directional antenna, however we are renovating the room that our television is normally in so we had to move all our equipment to the other side of the house. Because of this and the fact that our neighbor's house is quite close on the side where we have to put the new antenna, our standby antenna did not have enough boost to pick up signals consistently.  Which is why we purchased this product, for its greater range and higher signal power.  So far it seems to work quite well, and we are getting clear signal for the stations that we really care about watching. Good Job!

I live about 8 miles away from a town with around 100,000 residents. I was only able to pick up one tower that is transmitting four channels (main channel plus 3 sub channels)...and it only picks up that tower under perfect weather conditions. There is no good way to test mount the antenna for reception testing prior to peeling the adhesive backing for mounting. If you have to move the antenna after sticking it to the wall, good luck as the adhesive backing will be rendered useless after that. Let's all give a tepid round of applause to our inept government for killing off the tried and true and always functional analog transmission towers for the super state of the art HD digital towers that work great IF you live within 100 feet of the tower.

We live 35 miles west of Boston, and recently cut the cable. No more cable TV for us, but we did miss all the local programing. After doing a little research we purchased the "U Must Have" HD TV antenna with amplifier. Our TV did performed a channel scan, and the antenna pulled in 127 TV stations, all of them crystal clear. We highly recommend!

This is a very good antenna I went from 31 channels with my other antenna to 57 channels with this antenna using the included amplifier I have it hanging from my ceiling and I live in a basement that shows that this is a great 👍🏻 antenna in my opinion if it works in the basement which I didn’t think 🤔 it would, I taught that I would have to buy an outside antenna which I didn’t want to. Lightweight good price and can be used in black side or white side to match with your decor. So I’m happy 😊 so far with my purchase.

I bought 4 of these. 3 of the four locations in my home were potentially good spots, the fourth not so good. Three of the four good spots pulled in at least 50 stations, the fourth pulled in 28 stations after only one scan. The antennas were easy to install and I was pleasantly surprised at how well they worked. Between these antennas and my Roku devices, I will be ready to cut the cable cord soon. You have a satisfied customer!

I recently hooked up my antenna which took about 2 minutes. It's very simple and easy. I am not getting the channels I expected to however. I still get around 8 channels where I had none before. The picture quality on all is perfect. The antenna is very sensitive. I set it up then lost some channels after tucking the wires behind the TV stand. I would recommend putting the wires where you want them then finding the best place for the antenna itself. Overall I am very satisfied with this product and would recommend it to a friend.

I moved into a valley. Mountains everywhere. I missed way too many football games last season fooling around with "top brand" much more expensive antennas to get stuck in that trap again this season. I could never get all the channels to tune in and no one spot was an "all clear" position. Some channels were audio only. Others had cloudy pictures. And others would show in my channel listing but never tune at all. Immediately after finishing a channel scan, this antenna delivered the promised HD clear quality picture and sound on EVERY channel in my channel list. Even picked up channels I didn't even know where available in my area. Before I saw 32 channels. Now there are over 40. And each one tunes. This antenna is amazing especially fit its price. I'll be getting this antenna for all my other rooms with televisions, for sure.
Got the antenna today via Amazon and I must say I was a bit doubtful atfirst of just how many channels I would get. The install was very easy and

I really only purchased this because my dad was worried about me having the news since I don't have cable TV. I use Hulu and Netflix for my show entertainment. So when he suggested me getting a antenna the thought never crossed my mind. I did a quick search and settled in on this product. Great decision! It was easy to install and the channels came in. I get 28 free channels! All reminiscent of my childhood! Some of the picture is a bit shakey and hard to watch, but overall, it gets the job done. Especially in times of crisis and chaos like now (COVID-19).  Thanks.

This is the second HD antenna I purchased and the rated distance is farther. I selected this one because the home I installed it in is a few more miles out of town than the first. The installation was super simple and the picture was nice and crisp. The cool thing was that this antenna picked up stations with it mounted very close to the TV (and almost the center of the home) whereas the first one I purchased has to be on, or, within a few feet of an outer wall.  That's super important because mounting can be potentially very difficult and visually undesirable. Note: All reception will not be the same and is based on the distance from, and physical obstructions to, the TV stations' broadcast signal.

This is the best, I got it hooked up yesterday and scanned for channels and only got a few, but it was a now storm, but at least a local abc channel so I can see/hear the local news. Was SO happy I almost cried and LOVED calling DISH to turn off their TOO EXPENSIVE service. I know there are other channels available, but live in a valley, so just need to find the best position for the antenna. WE CANNOT BELIEVE THE CLARITY OF THE PICTURE ON A OVER 10 YEAR OLD SONY 1080, SO IMPRESSED. And the network channel we do get right now, is one that DISH and the local were fighting about so hadn’t had it for a few months. thank you for this product!

We have an older rooftop antenna on our house. With an expensive booster we were able to pick up some local channels.Unfortunately about a year ago that booster went bad and we could only pick up a couple of the closest  stations with bad reception.

Yesterday I received my Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna.  It came packaged very nicely without any damage to speak of.  After opening and unwrapping the contents, it took about 5-10 minutes to set it up, scan for channels and begin watching live television.  To describe this thing in one word......”amazing!”  I am now able to watch 36 local channels and that was without changing the placement or orientation of the antenna.  I will experiment a little with that, because I’m sure that I will be able to pick up more if I move it around a bit.  Thank you so much for a great product.  I will be purchasing another for a family member.- Easy/quick set up

I just installed my new HD TV Antenna I purchased from Amazon. Installation was very simple. Had to move the antenna around a couple of times to get all of my local channels but it wasn't a big deal. Finally got in over a hundred channels including ones I never even knew existed.Very pleased and can't wait to brag about it to my friends that are paying way too much for tv through there providers.

We got rid of cable and wanted something to watch local channels (especially when our internet goes out and there is no streaming option for a time!).  We were able to hook up this little antenna quickly and easily and have been receiving the local channels just fine.  Sure enough, 3 days after we installed this antenna, our internet was out for 2 hours and this antenna worked great!  We are very pleased and anticipate many hours of enjoyment due to having this device.  Thanks for a great product!

After my antenna was blown off my room I was looking at purchasing and antenna to put in my attic.  I wasn't thrilled at the prospect of crawling around in the attic in the middle of summer.  I came across this indoor antenna and thought with the low price I could afford to give it a change.  Initially I tried the antenna without the amplifier and got a good number of stations.  I was honestly very surprised how many more I got with the amplifier.  I've been using it for a couple months without any complaint.

I live 10 miles outside DC and have tons of broadcast towers within 30 miles.  I could only get 4 channels with this particular antenna.  Now I will say that this was for my bedroom where my windows all face away from the city.  It may be that you need a window that clearly faces the towers.  Didnt work either when I put it on the wall that faces city.I do have an antenna input in the attic that isn't powered and that works great hooked up to living room tv.  Was looking for an easier option for bedroom.

I was tired of paying for cable TV and not watching any channels except if you were local channels and news. Plus the local cable provider always hiked up the fees. I am a recent cord cutter and  I researched online to see which antenna would  suit my needs. I am impressed by “you must have” antenna. I get approximately 60 channels in the Phoenix metro area. Now I’m never paying for cable TV. Thank you very muchPros:

I won a 10 cent bet with my husband that it would work fine in the basement. Just had to put antenna near a window.  Now I need to set one upstairs in the living room, the great deal of getting a second one is highly unusual in today’s business world. ‘‘This  company makes  a great product and has the confidence to sell it at a great price!  Be sure you try different locations to get the best reception. Try it without the amplifier, then add the amplifier before moving it.  Good luck and enjoy much more economical tv viewing!

Order ID#114-602-6133-5271467 one day delivery with prime.Antenna packaged very well no missing components, installation straight forward.  Plan to spend a little time finding the right mounting location and scanning for channels. On my first scan I got 35 channels and on my final position and scan I received 44 channels.  The high definition is very good. Have  some minor pixelation but not on channels I would tune to anyway.  This antenna has gotten me one step closer to cutting the cable, glad I made the purchase.

This antenna works as advertised. To be honest , I did not have high hopes. I felt like it was too good to be true and that I would only get a handful of channels. The antenna picked up 46 digital channels and a few analog.  The picture quality is crystal clear. I am currently watching the 2020 superbowl with zero issues. I am totally satisfied with this product so far.

I live about 30 miles from tower in the suburbs. Ive tried short and long range and moving the antenna to multiple spots on a large window that faces a wide open sky directly to the tower. I scan and receive maybe 8 spanish channels but they dont even work properly. Ive tried getting help through their 800 number but no oje callw back. I tried email and they just copy and paste instructions.  They said someone would call me to help. No calls in 2 days.

Simple setup. What I appreciate is the signal booster. I dont know if it helps, but having the window facing condos, it may help with getting a signal.What stinks is not able to get the vhf channels and that could be a number of factors, but the antenna itself isnt the problem.

This is a very good antenna so far.  I was able to get 60+ channels.  Very easy to set up.  I selected the long range option to get the most channels, and I moved my antenna a few times before I found a place that worked best.  Tip - keep moving your antenna around and even flip it to see what works best for maximum channels.  I was stuck at 20 for awhile until I found a spot right under my window sill.

I bought this antenna as a stopgap to get some off the air TV reception until next summer when I intended to put up a TV tower.  I live in a valley surrounded by trees.  I have a 64 inch plasma HDTV in my finished basement (underground) to make matters worse.  The city broadcasting is a little over 20 miles away.  I connected the coax for antenna to the TV and then placed the antenna itself vertically under the ceiling tile (from a dropped ceiling).  I got ABC and Fox immediately and crystal clear.  Turning the antenna allowed me to receive other CBS and NBC.  It was as simple as that.  I am very pleased with my purchase.

Changed my review after 3 months.. It works fine sometimes, but most of the time I was always having to reposition it some where, and if I held my mouth right it worked as long as I stood on my left foot.I still have it and I ordered a higher price one that hooks up out side,  It works almost perfect . you should consider paying more in your purchase....4/5/20 update I took it outside to my man barn and hooked it up and it works fine out there so far, so it a signal reception issue depending on your placement.

It took me about 5 minutes to hook it up and scan for channels. I went from 12-13 channels with rabbit ears to 45 channels!!!.  You can barely see it from outside.
