My one suggestion for installation is to tape it to the window with a piece of removable tape, then do autoscan on your TV. I did have to move mine over a bit because the metal stairs were in the way.  After you find the right spot, use the 3M double-sided tape included.

I have been terrified to cut the cord with cable and I finally got upset last week and decided to order your antenna. I received it on Sunday but I was hesitant to do anything with it. Finally, I called my cable company and told them to cancel my cable subscription. Twenty minutes later, my cable is gone and I put up the antenna. I admit I was worried it wouldn't pick up anything because we are in a weird spot on the fourth floor of an apartment building where service is not consistent. However, we managed to get 49 channels! We are so pleased with the antenna! I am shocked at the clarity of the channels, too!

waste of money. does not get local channels like ABC, NBC, CBS. I thought this would allow me to watch NFL on sundays but it only gives you BS channels like "watch kids play fortnite" and streaming video garbage channels.

REVISED UPDATE: this is now the second Antenna I bought. This was for a family member in a different state. They LOVE IT! Ultra HD picture clarity AND saves money when you dont need cable.... once again - great buy!............I'm really impressed! The picture quality is amazing! Full HD... I was nervous it wouldn't work because I live high up in an apartment building with somewhat poor reception - NOPE... did not affect the antenna one bit. I highly recommend it!!!

I purchased this for a backup where I live and work. I live in a coastal City, and with hurricane season here, I wanted something in case we lose cable and or internet for local stations. I installed this last weekend, very easy, no directions needed. Scanned, and it found 6 channels, I worked with it for about 10 minutes or so, and finally found the best location, which found 11 channels, but please note that I live in an apartment and the walls are all concrete, and fire walls, and I often struggle to get cell signal inside, so this is great! Wonderful picture, crisp and clear. Only 1 channel that freezes and that is a PBS station that we do not watch. Wonderful and cost effective antenna!

I’ve  seen several of these and even tried a couple. Thought I would try one more  time and this time, it worked fine, although the company doesn't quite get it. After installation, I am receiving all of the local channels. The broadcast distance is only about 20 miles. After a few tries, I discovered that leaving the wire fully extended makes it work best because it becomes part of the receiver. It is not co-axial cable. An earlier version failed  and that seems to be why. The instructions don’t mention this in the Chinglish used to explain the set-up. No cable management here. String it all out!

I got this antenna to replace my existing indoor antenna which was rated for 50+ miles with a signal booster.  I can say that this new antenna is more sensitive and/or the booster is better than my old antenna.The following test was done in my two story house on a clear weather day.

I abandond cable TV when I realized I was paying $48/mo. for the basic package (as a new subscriber it would be even more) for something I never watched.  Most of the channels were worthless or of no interest to me.  The only thing I missed was the major network channels, e.g. Sunday night football on NBC.  Then I heard about digital TV.  I bought the Gesobyte Digital Antenna with some trepidation: I'm not very good when it comes to hooking up technical things.  However, all I had to do was plug in a cord into my TV and it worked.  The first channel I got was NBC, and the HDTV was far better than what you see on cable.  I watched the first game at the new SoFi Stadium last night, and I wouldn't have been able to get that channel without the digital antenna. I am delighted with this and am telling all my friends about it.

OK, so I tried an antenna years ago and had terrible reception so I was not optimistic.  But, we switched to streaming only from cable and wanted to get local channels in case we ever needed local news.  To my shock, we get over 30 channels and all of the local ones look great so I am thrilled.  Will add another one upstairs, and I will recommend since everyone is asking me for advice now on streaming. It doesn't show in the photos but one side of the antenna is white, so it is camouflaged on my white wall.

I have bought two of these. I bought the first one about 5 months ago for my RV. I took it to my daughters house in the country and hooked it up because the didn’t have cable. It worked so well my son-in-law bought one for his trailer and my daughter kept the other. I just bought another to replace the one my daughter kept. I do a lot of off the grid camping in my RV and this gets channels when others can’t!

G’bye $200 monthly cable bills!! We  easily installed this item- found the best wall for reception after moving it around- it sets itself up- we found MANY GREAT  channels- couldn’t be happier- of course we’re still paying for internet but the cable package monthly bills are GONE FOREVER! We’re never going back to cable- our smart tv gives us many options; we are subscribers to Amazon, Netflix & Hulu too. We highly recommend this tv “antenna “ to everyone! We brought back one we bought at Home Depot- this one is much better!

My HD TV Antenna with amplified signal booster is working exceptionally well. Even though the TV is mounted on a wall in the middle of the house and the antenna is placed near the floor on that wall, the channels still connect and the picture is stable and clear.I have this connected to a 4k Roku TV, and the built in Roku had no problem utilizing the antenna’s signal. It pulls in more channels (33!) than my other HD TV antenna (older model, different brand) that is mounted on an exterior wall and doesn’t have a signal booster. The instructions were way more than I expected for a device that is essentially so user friendly you can just plug-n-play.

I purchased the antenna for local channels since I don't have a cable subscription but still wanted access to local news. It arrived quickly and was packaged well. Setup and install was easy but finding the perfect location to get the most channels was tricky. If I just put it up and left it as was I had about 12 channels right away, but I wanted additional stations so I played with the location to find the sweet spot and ended up with 26 channels. It works great and weather doesn't seem to impact the signal either. The only thing is the glue dots that come with it are great for the initial install but once removed can't be reused and leave a residue that is difficult to remove. So I would suggest put it and leave it or if you think you might want to move it then use clear tape instead. Overall a great product and I would recommend it.

I have to say I wasn't sure how this antenna was going to perform. But after hooking it up I was amazed. My son and I first hooked it up in our backyard on a pole just temporarily to see if we could get CBS network for the LSU Bama game this Saturday. I have cable with all the channels but I was just looking for something portable with a flat screen outside under the patio as I haven't yet installed a cable outside with a permanent TV installation. We are about 40 miles north of New Orleans by way of the crow flies. Being in the backyard and pointing the antenna South, even though it was on a pole, we will pretty much point in it at the roof of my house. To my surprise, we picked up 17 channels. So then I told my son let's set the antenna on side of the house pointing South to get a clear a path. Wow! We actually picked up 40 channels including a perfect HD CBS channel.

It didn't improve the reception at all or increase the number of stations.  Practically every station I want to access cuts out or quits receiving altogether.  I exchanged it for my previous antenna because it touted that you can receive from over 100 miles and it is worse than the one I removed.  We live in the Twin Cities.

We replaced one of our older OTA Amplified TV Antennas with this on, and the difference is night and day!  When a townhome was built next door, blocking our "view" of the mountain top with the TV transmitters, we lost most of our OTA reception ability, despite considerable efforts to relocate the antenna.  I saw this one and gave it a try.  Amazing!  We now have over 40 OTA signals, all digital, and all truly great quality viewing.  I would, and will, buy this product again!

I have purchased two of these HD antennas from Amazon.  We live in the rural south and our bigger metropolitan area is about 60 miles northwest.  We had an outdoor antenna which was able to pick up all the major local TV stations.  However, our outdoor antenna got knocked over by a tree recently and I just did not feel like rewiring another outdoor antenna back into the house.  So, my wife asked about indoor antennas.  At first, I was skeptical as I am used to "rabbit ears" and am not familiar with your flat design.  To our surprise, we got very good reception.  We were able to get a total about 15 channels which was slightly less than our outdoor antenna.  The picture quality is great - about as good if not better than our old antenna.  I would definitely recommend the HD antenna not only for the reception but ease of installation.  We just placed the antenna on the wall.I cannot wait to get another antenna so that I can put a TV in my study.

We recently made the decision to go from a  cable tv subscriber to an internet only household but found ourselves lacking the local news during this pandemic which made us nervous. My father suggested we purchase an antenna to obtain the channels within our area. Honestly, I never knew this was an option anymore. We received our antenna and had it set up in less than ten minutes and had way more channels than we initially thought was possible. The clarity of the picture is perfect and exactly what we needed. I have already told at least 6 families how great this is and sent them the link to purchase it themselves.

After getting super annoyed with the only cable company that supports our semi-rural home, we decided to cancel it. It wasn't really a problem until football season started to roll around the only place we could stream primetime football was on our little phones on the Yahoo app. My dad started talking about how at his work place, they don't have cable and watch football with an antenna! After looking at Walmart, I found this flat and small one on Amazon and we set it up downstairs!The picture quality is AMAZING! As clear as watching from our Playstation! So happy and so ready for football Sundays!

I will compare this to my previous antenna which is 5 years old and lost 8 channels, 2 of which I need for sports. I am about 28 miles from our transmitting towers and just like my old antenna when it was new, I could not get a complete channel reception by mounting inside. Mounted behind TV and by window using the long range setting I was missing NBC and Telemundo. Could be to the fact that my home is block and dual pane windows or maybe just palm trees and structures in between. Anyways I moved the new antenna into the attic where the old antenna resides now and using the long range amplifier I was able to receive all available channels. Although I had to do a little of work to achieve receiving the complete channels available in my area I am very satisfied with the antenna, especially compared to my old one that was located in the same spot and would not receive 8 channels. I like it better in the attic to it is not noticeable in the living room.

I recently moved from the central part of my town to another (south of a mountain range), and discovered that the non-amplified HDTV antenna that worked at the old address was no longer good enough. Based on customer ratings, I ordered the amplified U Must Have Digital HDTV Antenna a week or two ago.As expected, assembly is simple – merely screwing in connectors and plugging into a USB port on my television. The antenna is nice and flat, and I easily hid it behind the mounting bracket for the TV. One nice touch is that the antenna is black on one side and white on the other, giving better choices for making it inconspicuous.

This HDTV antenna could not have been easier to install.  Simply plug it into the powered USB on the TV panel, and onto the RF antenna post and begin scanning for channels.  The adhesives make it easy to attach to the back of the TV, or to the wall behind the TV.  It took only 5 min to set up!

I cut our cable about a year ago.. we also cut down expenses with these online streaming services..however, if I had known about this product a year ago, I would have boughten it then. I live around bunch of hills (Santa Clarita) and I was already assuming there is no way I’m getting any reception with any antenna!! But wait, I purchased this antenna and after moving it all around my living room, I actually was able to get 50 free channels, 2,4,5,7,9 Spanish Channels and Asian channels. I was so surprised!! I would however buy extra self adhesive stickers, just in case ..

I just received my new HDTV antenna through Amazon and I was really hoping for the best. My last antenna I purchased from Walmart and it barely got channels. This antenna was to be used in my kids rooms to get Channel 10.3 PBS Kids. I was hoping that it would give them that channel clear with no static and it DID. I am so happy about this purchase. Normally when I scanned channels with the Walmart antenna I would only get 30 - 40 static channels. But with this antenna i was able to get 65 channels. I am so pleased with this purchase and intend to buy more for my living room and bedroom. This was super easy to install. & I hung it in my window the antenna came with little sticky pads and it is very thin

I bought the HDTV Antenna for my mom because she was having trouble watching her Spanish speaking channels on our local airwaves. We were using an old antenna from the early 2000’s or possibly from the late 90’s to watch our local tv channels on an 60in tv. Sometimes the signal strength wasn’t enough for some of the Spanish speaking channels to display properly which cause my mom to miss her favorite Spanish Soaps.After we bought the HDTV antenna with amplifier and installed following easy setup guide. The signal strength improved was much improved and even displayed her favorite Spanish speaking channels without any loss of signal.

I placed the antenna in a basement window.  I tried this antenna on a late model sony tv and went through normal tv antenna channel discovery.  It resulted in finding only a few digital channels.I then tried a initial setup of the tv and antenna from the setup menu.  The tv discovered over 40 digital channels with outstanding clarity.  We had to select wide to get the best HD picture.  This antenna was a wonderful acquisition and I rate it 5 stars

We had some older digital antennas that we recently tried but the quality was not there on the signal.  We decided to see if new technology in digital antenna had improved.  Our new HDTV antenna arrived yesterday as ordered thru Amazon.  It was AMAZING.  Within 15 minutes of unpacking the antenna and letting our HDTV discover all of the channels, we were watching TV in brilliant HD quality for all the local channels.  No in and out signal but clear and consistent.  I am a believer !

Want to save over $1500 a year? You need to get yourself one of these. I believe almost anyone can install one. After Comcast raised the bill again I had enough so it was time to look for a different way to watch TV. Taking a chance I ordered one of these. What a surprise when it was hooked up and turned the set on. Crystal clear picture, 40 + channels in an area where I don't even get cell service. Great product, buy one and save yourself a ton of money and ENJOY IT !!!

Just got my new antenna (purchased on Amazon) and hooked it up to my Samsung TV.Super easy to install...great directions, simple to install and very well made. Hooked it up, set TV source to "antenna" and scanned channels. It located over 60 channels, some I never heard of !

Before buying this Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna I was only able to see 4 channels on my TV.  After installing this antenna, and scanning for new channels, I now have 120 channels.  Wow, I couldn't believe it!  I placed the antenna by a window near the TV.  It's very light and it doesn't take any space at all.  The installation is so easy, and I believe it will last for years.  I strongly recommend it!

It was like magic. In just seconds I was able to see 34 HD TV Channels that I previously able to view none of. In less than 1 month it will pay for itself since it enables me to cancel the Streaming cost for a lot of these channels that I had to pay a monthly fee for.I was able to get all of these Channels from the window (backside of my curtains) beside my downstairs TV in Colorado Springs with lots of mountains.

We were previously using rabbit ears style antenna, and kept having the signal distort, drop, and lost channels even with clear weather (probably the wind blowing trees or something).I installed this new HDTV antenna and now get 56 channels, up from the 30 we were getting, plus we get the channels we actually want: PBS, Fox, ABC, MeTV.

I've been trying different antennas for our lower level room TV on and off for years.  This one shocked me because it worked incredibly well by comparison....and I did not have to fiddle around aiming it.  Its performance is good 24/7, not just at some parts of the day.  The price was very fair too.And I appreciate it not having rabbit ears to catch on items in the room and break off!!

I purchased this antenna, for my bedroom, my tv comes in crystal clear without having to move the antenna all around, love that it comes with little stickers to put the antenna anywhere and will not come off them and I would diffidently purchase this again, Very pleased with it,

The antenna works very good.  It took a little trial and error to figure out where to hang it in my house but I now get all the local channels in my area.  The channels come in nice and clear some of them better than when I had cable.  I believe I get about 36 channels I was able to pick up 45 in one area but it didn't get fox 53 so I moved it to be able to get that channel instead of some of the others.  For the price and ease of use it is definitely worth it. It helps save me money and my husband is happy because he didn't want to deal with hooking up an outdoor antenna!

This antenna is a game-changer literally. Before having this I tried several different antennas to try and pull in our local station that has our local MLS Soccer games. I could never get it to come in clear regularly. After installing this antenna not only do I get this channel with a great signal but I am also pulling in almost 20 additional channels that I did not get previously.

When FOX pulled their broadcasting from DISH prior to the NFL playoffs and Super bowl we were unable to view them and still unable to view any FOX programs on DISH.So we watched it for FREE!!!, because we purchased the HDTV Antenna and received a perfect picture and was able to view FOX and many other channels and are still able to view them. This has made us VERY HAPPY!!!

We have recently moved to a new area of the country and wanted to try our luck with antenna tv. Being about an hour outside of a large city, we went to the store and bought the antenna with the best reviews and longest distance. It was challenging to put together, and even then we had to play with the angle multiple times and were finally able to get a handful of channels. Slightly discouraged, we were hesitant to try anything else, but decided to take a chance on one more antenna just to have some comparison. We purchased the Ultra-Thin HDTV Antenna. It was so easy to install and there were no angles to play with. When we searched for channels, it found 59! We couldn’t believe it. Not only were there so many channels, they were also coming in crystal clear. We strongly recommend this antenna as it was easy to install and really works!

The channels are the UHF channels available with any good quality HDTV antenna. This one does offer a higher quality than most.  I was surprised to find additional sub channels for stations I had assumed never had any.  The use of the sticky pads allows me to adhere the antenna to the window and the long cable makes it possible for me to use it from a location not requiring me to keep the TV close to the window. I'm using the USB power source required,and I'm doing so from the computer, although they provide a power outlet plug also.The 2nd unit is an extra bonus

I bought the Digital HDTV Antenna (LPN PM 14061) as a replacement for my getting-more-expensive-by-the-month cable provider. Using the easy-to-follow instructions, I found the ultra-thin flat antenna to be extremely easy to attach to a nearby window & the cable was long enough to connect my TV without any difficulty. After connecting the provided external power adapter, channel scanning with the TV native remote was pretty quick & easy (Google over-the-air digital channels in your area or simply go to fcc.gov/media/engineering/dtvmaps), and I was pleasantly surprised at the number of digital channels found by the antenna & pleased to see that a number of channels found were those I had with my cable provider! Finally, the quality of the programs displayed for practically all the channels found was much better & sharper than I expected!

We just purchased the amplified HD digital tv antenna.  It arrived in only one day.  It took less time to set up the antenna than it did to figure out how to scan for channels on the tv itself.  We had tried an indoor antenna years ago and due to our location were not able to get any reception.  With your antenna we are able to access 13 channels that come in as clear as cable.  After recently cutting the cable cord, we were thrilled especially considering the price.  We would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to cut the cord!

There is nothing to dislike and everything to love, from the well packaged and illustrated contents to the ease of assembly.  Plenty of cable and cord length without the need of extensions.  After rescanning for available channels I picked up 30% more and with sharper imaging than with my unamplified previous antenna.  There was also no picture breakup on channels where there had been before.  I would give this antenna more than 5 stars if I could.

Nothing to really assemble, just plug it into the cable connection on the TV and run a scan channels program from the remote.We live ten miles north of Tucson, unobstructed by tall buildings or mountains and we are only able to pick up three stations, not the most popular ones at that.

I received the gesobyte antenna today and went right to hooking it up.  It is incredibly easy to hook up. All you need to do is screw in thecoaxial cable and plug in the power cord and you're off and running in less than 5 minutes.  As far as the quality goes I am very impressed with the resolution of this antenna on my 4k Samsung smart TV.  It is very sharp and the colors are great, I watched some nhl hockey and some college football

Works great, lightweight, easy to hook up, I got 50 channels, but most importantly I got all the big networks. There is also a lot of good content on some of the other local broadcasts and then there are a lot that I will be deleting but overall there is more free over the air content than expected, I'm going to try one in my RV to see what happens. I couldnt get to a window so I put it on the wall above my TV and got 2big networks in 1080i and 1 in 720i which still looks good

Super easy to set up and adjust to get even more channels. At first I hooked it up without the extra signal strengthener and got many more channels without even searching; they were just there but channel 12 didn't come in so I hooked up the signal strengthener and put it up on the wall right behind the TV (because I don't want to see it) and got twice as many channels when I went into the TV and did the auto tune. Great product, great results.

Overall this product is great. Within a few minutes installed, and depending on the antenna location we were picking up 19 to 40+ channels. A couple words of caution, we had a lot of electrical equipment (tv, sound bar, hdmi switch, blu-ray player and roku). When re-connecting all these devices the electrical interference dropped channels. Do plan to set up the antenna several feet away if you have many electrical devices and don't allow the antenna in ditect contact with metal. Our antenna is maybe 10-15 feet away from the TV and we are still picking up 29 channels.  Secondly, the switch between short/long range is ~1 1/4" wide and there is no quick disconnect between the antenna and the switch.  Therefore if going through a wall to mount, the hole has to be ~1 1/2" in diameter to route everything. Otherwise love it!

I purchased an Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna the other day because I finally got rid of cable television.  I wanted an antenna to get the local channels to watch college football when (if) it starts back this year.I was a little hesitant and didn't know what to expect but the technology has come a long way from the rabbit ears of old.  There was some moving around of the antenna to get the best signal and number of channels but I have to say I was very impressed with how wonderful it works.  The channels came in HD on a 75" TV and just as good as Comcast.  I am a fan and will be keeping it around.  I am now saving $90 a month by getting rid of cable.  I was able to get a total of 43 channels off the antenna.

Awesome antenna! First of all... I live in the country and only get 5 channels on the 40 ft. Tower antenna. I put a TV in my shop and I was looking for a good antenna, I didn't want to pull cable from there.. I tried 2 other brands and could only get 3 stations. Then i ordered this one and WOW!  It's awesome,  now I receive 12 channels, some from a 100 miles away. Crystal clear picture!

This product did not work for me. I tried it a dozen times and even contacted Sony for assistance. USB was tried in both the TV USB outlet as well as wall plugin. The amp was receiving power both ways, but simply couldn’t find any channels. I’m only 15 miles from Seattle and didn’t find a single channel. I was really hoping this would work, but will need to unfortunately return this product.

Clear HD picture once set up.  This device was easy to setup.  Keep in mind: if your tv does not have a USB connection, then you need to plug the amplifier into the wall.  I set up the antenna on an interior wall with TV stations in Green Bay WI approximately 40 miles away.  I suspect there is some HVAC (metal) in the wall affecting the signal, but I was able to find a spot where the signal comes in.  I get all the basic OTA channels.  HD quality.  There are TV stations 80 miles away in Wausau, WI.  These stations do not come in through the antenna.  I live on a hill, not a valley.  I highly doubt this antenna would reach 120 miles, especially inside a house.  My thoughts: excellent antenna.  Works good for my needs (basic TV/HD quality).  However, I suspect it works best within 30 miles of towers.  Antennas beyond 45 miles will be very difficult to pick up.

The Antenna came promptly, well packaged, included nice instruction with pictures, good quality paper. The installation was very easy for a person like myself with average tech 'digital' skill! I have been using only for last few hours but the picture quality and availability of many channels is definitely right antenna for me. The customer reviews and the seller's answers made a big difference in making mu decision. I may provide additional comments later on if warranted after extended experience.

This was my first time looking at antenna's, I didn't want to spend over $40 on one because I didn't want to waste money on something that may not work. After reviewing products at local stores and I decided to come to Amazon. And this was the first product that popped up for me. I was hesitant on buying it, but now that I have it, I love it. Definitely recommend this product, it's easy to hook up, easy to operate and I love the interface that it has. Definitely a 10/10!

I went to Walmart, bought what I thought was a nice antenna, and haven’t been able to watch my tv since I dropped cable. I was starting to regret this choice. But I saw the reviews for this hdtv antenna, and the reasonable cost, and thought I would give it a try.... all I can say is WOW. My husband casually set it in a chair next to the tv while setting it up, and it got such a clear signal. This was before we even mounted it on the wall. Personally we didn’t end up with any more channels then before, but that’s not a problem. Literally the only thing we cared about was being able to watch the local channels we had without it cutting out. If you’re wondering if you should buy this antenna, yes, buy it.

Despite fearing the worst in terms of setup, the antenna proved as easy to set up as advertised. I was particularly concerned I’d need an additional cable to attach it to my new Recast DVR, but none was needed! Tough extremely light, one may need a few more double sided stick-Ins depending on the surface. Overall, extremely satisfied with ease of use, included cords, quality & number of stations, and the price for the extended warranty.

My husband and I recently cut the "cable cord" from Xfinity/comcast and we are very happy that we did. Now, we have AT&T internet.  We were looking for affordable streaming service that offers local channels for less than $30.00 per month. We tried Sling, however,  my husband is a huge sports fan and Sling doesn't include your local channels like CBS, Fox, and local news. Here is where the antenna comes into play. We ordered this antenna after watching a YouTube channel regarding antennas. We are thrilled about the HDTV quality and the amount of channels, originally we only received 7 channels, but after mounting the antenna on the wall. We were able to receive 18 channels.  We are able to receive all of the good free channels like, CBS, Fox,ABC, court tv, me tv, H&I, get tv, decades, Dabl, start tv, and many more. Easy to follow instructions, set up took me less than 5 mins.

We are amazed at the picture quality with this little gem. It took us about 45 minutes to figure out how to set up our Samsung smart TV, but that's not the Antenna's fault. We were concerned because our TV is on the north side of the house and all the close towers are to the south, but no worries! The antenna is on the north side next to the TV, not in a window, and it pulled in 42 channels. Wow!

I gave this antenna a negative review but after hearing from the manufacturer and making adjustments to its location the reception is much better.  The image is clearer and I don't have to reset the channels as before.  It's important that you learn where the towers are so you can place the antenna in the correct location.  You can find the locations on line.

This is my first time using this antenna. I'm very pleased on how easy it was to set up. The packaging was super impressive. I was shocked at how quickly I was able to get channels the moment I connected the antenna to the tv.My only negative was the stickers that came with it...they do not adhere to the wall very long, I just used a command strip and all is well.

I do not ever write reviews nor do I really take them seriously.  In my quest to "cut the cord" with cable, I just wanted something to get local channels free.  This antenna was really my guinea pig test and it passed with flying colors!!!  The reviews said how easy it was to set up and the clear HD pictures was exactly what I was looking for.  The instructions were so easy and literally took minutes to set up.  It has a beautiful picture and you can't tell if you are watching cable or antenna.  I didn't know there were so many free channels out there!!!  I will be buying a couple more of these for my other TVs.Thanks for putting out a great product!!!  I am recommending this to friends and family.

Just thought I’d send a note on the excellent reception I now receive on my TV since installing the antenna. I’m now receiving 54 stations. I did what your install instructions recommended and have 9 more stations using the amplifier than without it. The antenna works well positioned at the top corner of a window. It will be so useful now if we have tornadoes or other bad weather to be able to see and hear the newscast near the safe zone in our home.

I bought one of these antennas through Amazon and I absolutely love it. It took me longer to move the TV out from the wall than it took me to install the antenna. Picture quality is  at least as good as cable, maybe even better. I bought this is the first step to cutting the cable, and I wish I would’ve done it 10 years ago. I get more local coverage with this than I did with cable. One additional advantage that I found is that I get to use the native TV remote instead of the cable remote. This gives me more options than the cable remote did. After installing this I’m definitely going through with the cable cutting. I should save close to $1200 a year by doing this.  I’m having a few issues with pixelation but Support has largely fixed the issue. I suspect we’re getting some interference from outside.  Support from the sellers has been outstanding. Emails immediately responded to with about 4 emails swapped within an hour of my first email.

I purchased your Amplified HD Digital TV antenna approximately 4 weeks ago after cancelling my cable subscription. I am very pleased with the quality of your product, the reception is outstanding. I live in the LA area and am able to receive over 40 channels, FREE!I purchased another antenna for my mother, and she is very happy as well.

My family lives in a valley which gives antenna's a hard time pulling in TV stations. The new "U Must Have" Amplified Digital Indoor HDTV Antenna easily installed in a few minutes. Even installed in the lowest part of the house the antenna gets 20 stations (FCC HDTV website shows 20 around our location) w/rock solid crystal clarity. YES !!!Awesome product that has allowed us to keep the cord cut, save money and is something we can recommend to others.

A week ago I purchased and attached the Ultra Thin HDTV Antenna.  I had been using rabbit ears with limited success as it received most, but not all, the major networks even though I live in a metro area.After attaching the Ultra Thin HDTV Antenna and running the auto program tv setting I was amazed at all the channels I received. I went from receiving 27 digital channels to receiving 45 digital and 1 analog channel.  All clear, even the ABC network the rabbit ears could never receive.  Additionally, all channels were received without need to use the amplifier provided with the antenna.

This antenna is perfect.  Very lightweight and powerful. The Antenna has been amazing so far and I am able to pick up 12 channels compared to the 3 that I was getting with my old antenna.  I also noticed that the strength od the channels is much higher.  My TV shows the strength of the signal when first change the channel and it’s ready 65 - 100 percent. On my old Antenna I would be lucky to get 50 percent.  so happy with this purchase.

I almost cut the cord last year but Direct TV gave me such a good deal, that I stayed around another year. However, that deal is up and I cannot afford to keep paying $80-100/month for TV.  I mainly watch the local channels and then watch movies through streaming services - so I finally decided to cut the cord. Before I did so I ordered several antennas from Amazon to try them out to make sure I could get local channels. I settled on this Digital HDTV Antenna because it brings in a great picture and the channels I need - and now no fees. Setup was easy as long as you know how to access the setup on your tv to search for channels. Pretty easy to find under the Menu of any TV remote.  The antenna has a nice long cord which I really appreciate- it allowed me to move it around to various sides of the room to determine where the best location would be for the most channels. The antenna is flat, white on one side, black on the other and very unobtrusive.  I'm looking forward to the money I'm saving in the next year!

Finally a great antenna! I’ve bought so many other antennas in the last 5 years through different living locations and this is by far the best antenna. I actually get every single channel clearly with no glitching and no having to move the antenna around to get certain channels better. And no having to go to a different room to get certain channels.It has a long enough cable so you can move it all over the place to find the best spot - as you can see in the pic I have it way up in the corner and the cord is actually draping down below the window not across. It’s very lightweight and thin, and it comes with a few sticky pads to stick the antenna where you want it (but all you need is one).

We purchased this antenna to watch the Super Bowl...since our DISH and FOX are having issues...the antenna was so very easy to install..and to tell you the truth we thought the picture was much better then the satellite.  Also, since it is just one small thin unit with no rabbit ear antenna attached it is very pleasing to the eye and so simple to just set it on the window sill...thank you for making a quality product.Mary and Lawrence Bryan

I was pleasantly surprised with how well this works. I was skeptical that it would give me a clear picture or that I would even receive more than one or 2 channels.I have 2 TV's that need to be hooked up, but I only bought one Antenna in case I couldn't get any reception.

The package arrived before expected which is always nice. Setup was incredibly easy with just a few coaxial cables to connect and just plug it in for power! Make sure to test out different places for the best reception before you finally mount the antenna. The reception was great initially but when I attached the power to it... WOW, it was amazing got a ton of channels. Another tip is to try rescanning if not all the channels come in. We placed ours high up on the living room window. Very discrete. The antennae itself is very lightweight. It's an HD quality picture and I'm not kidding the local channels look even better than they did when we had cable. This is one of the best purchases I've ever made. I am very pleased and would highly recommend this to anyone looking to cut the cord on expensive cable bills.

This perfectly replaced my rabbit ear style HD antenna. What I like most is the physical design. It’s as flat as a report cover, and about the same dimensions (like a sheet of paper.)It set up easily on my window pane and the wire was generously long, possibly 12 feet. That’s an estimate, I didn’t measure.

I just installed an antenna.  I have not had cable for over 12 years, as I have refused to pay the terrible cable prices.  Instead, I have opted for for Netflix and Amazon, but never had local channels, and would always get my news from the internet.  I didn’t realize that I would be able to obtain local channels but simply using this antenna!Using the easy directions, I was able to hook it up immediately, and had 22 channels!

The instruction manual was very detailed,easy to follow for connecting the antenna to the tv,scanning for local channels and how to place antenna in room for best reception. Also I like there are 3 mounting tabs for placing antenna on a wall. The antenna is light and pliable so it’s easy to adhere and stay on wall.I scanned for local channels after set up and was quite surprised and delighted to get 51 local channels,way more than I expected to get.

I ordered off of Amazon and it arrived through Prime Shipping 2 days later. Installation was very easy. I am glad that the USB power could work off of my TV's USB plug in. The antenna has both short and long range. This is very helpful. Setup was a breeze and after just 10 minutes of my TV scanning for channels, I now have 22 different channels! Great product and very easy to install!

Wow, what a great antenna! Super easy to install took 2 minutes. We had a previous antenna by another manufacturer I wasn’t pleased with it so I started researching and found this one. What a HUGE difference. The picture quality is great and we get so many more channels. The antenna is thin and lightweight. I would HIGHLY recommend!

We have had very good reception using this particular product with our television and just wanted everyone to know how easy it was to install and use once you determine where to put it in location.  This unit is being used in our spare bedroom for when we have company.  Our first purchase was put in our basement for a gym room television.  Both are perfect for the use and convenience needed to add additional channels for free!  Love the product!!

I received the HDTV antenna yesterday, and after the very easy installation, have been watching the numerous channels that were located during set up. Some are favorites that I have not been able to watch for years since switching to only streaming channels. Also, I like watching the news on my television and receive most local news channels. I am very satisfied with my purchase.

After being a loyal customer of streaming tv for what seemed like mostly just local channel's, and with the lineup changes and price increases my viewing time decreased. I decided to get rid of the streaming service, however with that came a loss of local channels. Not having an antenna for probably 25 years the thought never occurred to me until I decided to check out this particular item, which came recommended by a family member and boy was I surprised I have local channels now and no added cost or channels that I would never watch. The setup is easy, simple and the reception  is great, crystal clear channels. I have only encountered one or two brief moments of reception interruption, Which is common occurrence with antennas, which I expected. I would definitely recommend this product.

If you have been wanting to break up with cable, no excuses, this makes it easy!  We were paying for cable and most of the channels were junk, now we are getting what we want for FREE, this is easy to set up and the picture is clear, one room we are getting about 60 to 70 channels and the other room 50 some as there are no windows, but more importantly, no more monthly bill and have what I need and want!  Easy decision!

Our experience with the installation and use of the Ultra-Thin HDTV Antenna has exceeded our expectations. We were cautiously optimistic -- expecting the worse, but hoping for the best. To our delight, the latter was true. The antenna was easy to install -- the hardest part was trying to get our "smart TV" to program all the stations. Once we were able to program the channels, the antenna only took a little tweaking to locate the best direction of the transmitter signal.The price is right, the installation easy and the reception great. We are very pleased and will be recommending this antenna to family and friends.

Plain and simple, I tried about a half dozen antenna that looked similar to this. Non of them would bringall the stations in my area in. This one was the only one that worked. It proves that it is not what it looks like, but

Received it two days ago. I had already researched local station and new what direction to target for the best reception. It took about three (3) minutes to setup. Several more minutes to run channel setup on our TV.When the first channel appeared, we were shocked at how clear and sharp the screen was. Changing to our favorite channels, all appeared and were above excellent in reception and clarity.

I got this antenna to use for an outdoor TV on a covered porch. Could not have been easier to install. Mounted to a covered eave. Pulls in great signal strength. Very happy. Bought 2 more for other televisions.

This digital antenna has brought tv viewing pleasure to our entire family!  I purchased one to try it and it was so easy to install!  My husband was smart and ran the cable up to the attic so we got the best reception ever!  The antenna picks up more channels than we will ever watch.  They include all local channels, HSN, ION (my fav), CNN, ESPN and tons of Spanish channels.  I was so pleased that I ordered 2 more for my adult kids!
So much better than our older amplified antenna...no more episodes of fuzziness! Thank you!

I was expecting this antenna to be like all the others I had gotten, but instead it turned out to be just what we should all expect. So many channels and the quality of the picture is outstanding. Very little channels may fuzz a bit during cloudy weather but not anything to worry about as there are doubles on other channels it picks up. I replaced my cable TV and saving so much money now. This product actually is a true value.

Bought this so I could get rid of cable.  Installed it last night and connected it to an AirTV using Sling.  Set-up and installation was super easy and I've been able to receive between 30-50 channels depending on antenna placement.  I live 1/2 way between Baltimore and Washington, DC so there are a lot of channels available but almost all of them are 25-50 miles from my house.  All but the furthest stations come in strong.  Antenna placement and orientation make a difference.  The amplifier improved my reception a bit and pulled in some of the stations that are further away.  I highly recommend trying multiple locations (amplified and not) and then adjust based on the stations that are most important to you.  For example, I get the DC local stations using Sling so I am more interested in a strong signal from the Baltimore stations.

I got 32 crystal clear channels after placing the antenna in the best place possible. A bit disappointed that I couldn't get NBC. I am about halfway between Chicago and South Bend, less than 50 miles to both cities. Both cities have NBC towers. My elevation is 200 ft higher than Chicago and 100 ft higher than South Bend. Plus I'm in a clear rural area. Optimal conditions. This product does deliver however the advertised range is highly suspect. Hence the 3 stars. If you are closer to a tower this product might be perfect for you. I will probably return it and purchase a larger outdoor antenna which will most likely double the amount of channels i receive.

I bought this HDTV digital antenna on Amazon. It's was showing as a best seller and that it is. It works great! I use it on my new TV in the living room on the first floor of my house. I bought a digital antenna about two years ago for my big screen in my bedroom on the 2nd floor. It needed a power booster to pick up all the local channels and still has bad days on a couple even though I have it 10 feet up the wall of my bedroom since it has a cathedral ceiling. I was worried about this antenna being on the first floor and not having much room to get it up high. I have it sitting on the tv stand behind the tv and it still picks up all the channels with no problem. It has a very, very long coaxil wire to the antenna from the tv but I didn't need to get it up high. The entire assembly is very light weight. I was super surprised by how light weight. It's updated with 2020 standards so that must be making a difference. The price was right and the picture is great. On top of all that, setup took just a couple minutes. I would definitely recommend.Ken L.

We decided to put a hold on our Dish TV service to save money last week, and we were disappointed that we no longer could have the basic local channels. We had heard of other people having satellites for watching TV but never payed much attention to it, and had only tried the antenna that was in our camper when we got it which was spotty because of location reasons. We weren't sure how it would work, and we were pleasantly surprised! We got our local channels plus some! We did have to try a couple different locations for the antenna, and we found that the antenna worked better on the curtain rod above the window sideways than actually in the window. We would definitely recommend this antenna to others. The picture is great, and the price is very reasonable! Thank you for a good product!

Despite the inconsistency of the redundant channels, we don't view either way ... much of the common networks are quite clear; the reception is high definition, in as what has been identified. there are channels i hadn't even heard of, nor can i recall bein’ told of such networks.'bout 7min to install the components + 4 to configure the signals of each received channel

I am VERY happy with this antenna! It is the first step in helping me cut the cord! My satellite company does not carry FOX and I had to find a way to watch the Superbowl!Set up was easy. I am by myself and old enough to collect Medicare.  I had to move around a bit for best reception for the channels I am most interested in. The main TV is in the middle of the house and not near windows. I also have a metal roof. I found the sweet  spot for reception in about 20 minutes. A snow squall came thru while I was adjusting with no issues in pixelation.

Was really optimistic for this after all the positive reviews. Set it up using best practices I could find, in a window, facing the towers as per antenna web. Unfortunately, I still only get the same two Spanish language channels that I can pick up natively with my TV. I have it powered, ensured it was turned on, etc. Maybe I just live in an OTA dead zone. But I was really hoping, based on the reviews of other channels being unlocked that I might get at least a few more.

Recently I made the decision to discontinue our major satellite tv service.  We changed to an online streaming plan which includes other platform entertainment.  This new setup suits our household because it has saved us money in the long run.  The only thing missing was our local channels that provided our news channels and sporting events.  I decided to purchase this HDTV antenna after reading a lot of reviews.  I followed all the steps that came with the manual and had it hooked up with five minutes.  I had to manually scan the channels in my TV settings then VOILA!!! Crystal Clear local channels.  I will be purchasing another one to set up in the other room now that I know how easy it is to set up.  Thank you so much for making this easy for me!!!!

Unbox was easy and all parts and pieces were accounted for. Installation was straight forward. I really liked the adhesive backing that allowed for easy mounting of the antenna. The cord was plenty long enough and simple to attach into the back of my TV. I was able to search for channels which only took several minutes and I'm receiving all local air channels in resolution 480i and 1080i. The picture is as clear as regular HD from cable so I can easily say my expectations are met. I would recommend this product.

Antenna is very sleek & about the size of a sheet of paper. I mounted mine on the wall behind my 75” LG 4K tv, so it wouldn’t show. I instantly received about 30 channels. I moved it a few times & rescanned the channel’s to get the most I could. Also try turning the booster switch on & off. It helped me receive one local channel that we use frequently. Very pleased so far.

I bought this antenna in hopes to be able to cut the cord on Cable. Now B-4 I go on I did buy a new gold pated double shielded co-ax cord 25 foot. I had another cord that length that was quite old and the antenna did not perform like it should. With this new cord and this Antenna I couldn't be happier. I can get 34 channels and I live in Middle of Michigan in the country. One note it does take a little movement around your house to find the most optimum location.

My HDTV antenna has been remarkable.  We were debating about whether or not to get cable TV and decided to give this antenna a try.  It, basically, pulls in everything we need from local news stations as well as some great channels that I never expected to receive.  The quality of the HD channels is amazing!Thanks for a great product!

I got this antenna with some hesitation. The set up was simple enough. Scanned the channels, the number kept getting higher and higher. With our old antenna, it said we had 32 channels, but honestly, we can only get 4 "on a good day". I was thinking the same thing was happening with this new antenna. I WAS WRONG!!!We now have so many channels to watch which will allow us to "cut the cable" completely! Only will have to pay for the internet now.  This antenna is fantastic!!!

Easy enough to hook up, but it was really unstable as to getting channels to come in every time. Any movement in the slightest, and channel would get all choppy...if it stayed on at all. Move the antenna even a foot and rescan, and you probably won't get the same channels as before. Way too much trouble to miss with. I would get this cheap antenna if I were you.

I purchased on of these 4K UltgraHD 1080 (2020 edition) digital TV antennas earlier this week. It arrived quickly and in good condition.I opened the box, spent two minutes thumbing through the instructions, took another two minutes to hook up the antenna to the TV, then used the TV’s remote-control to scan, and immediately found 30+ free channels in our viewing area ( 25+ miles southwest of Chicago ).

Absolutely amazing!! All local channels along with over 100 channels. Made the switch after growing tired of raised cable prices no matter how much i tried to downgrade. The picture is sharp and clear. I hooked this up to the tv in my living room and it works perfectly providing all the channels i watch regularly. I thought I wouldn’t be able to get good reception but I was so happy to be wrong. I’m so happy to cut the cord with the cable company at last!

Need to have a direct line of sight to your local TV stations. I have moved this one 3×3 different levels three different TVs but the mountain to the north of me blocked all signal for my indoor attempts. I have an out door one on a mast 30 feet up and it works fine.  not unhappy with the antenna just my geographic location.Hope I can return, may have to eat it.

I didn’t put much hopes in this antenna, I had few before and they were a mess. Somebody recommended this one and I said let me try one more time. Amazing! It took about 5 minutes to install and when I did the scan it found 43 channels and they all work beautifully. Picture quality is very good, I placed it right on the window and I suppose this helps a lot. Cant believe I have so many channels without paying a cent for cable companies, I’m blown away!

So far so good. I do wish we could get a longer cable for it. But I can always rearrange the room. Clear picture . Several stations. Even some that we did not get with cable. We turned in the boxes from our spare rooms. No sense in paying for cable boxes in rooms that get very little uses... right?!Will get two more .one for hurricane kit, since the cable likes to go out during the storms. This way we are informed as to the progress and alerts of the storms. Easy to set up.

This is the first time I bought an HDTV antenna. I cut my cable because I don't need it anymore as I have HULU, Netflix, Disney+ and Amazon Prime. I bought this HDTV antenna specifically just for local channels/news. I can pickup up to 42 channels but most are spanish language channels and infomercial channels. I can pickup NBC, Fox and CW channels in HD though the clarity rivals cable broadcast if not better. For my purpose it is worth the money. Thank you.

I purchased your HD antenna on Wednesday of last week. I was so impressed with the antenna that I replaced my second antenna with another one of your Antennas. I love it. I had a question when trying to see channels and I emailed tech-support and immediately got a satisfactory answer which allowed me to fix my app TV do you receive all channels. Again I love the product and I recommend it to anybody that needs an HD antenna. Since I connected my antenna I have not watched cable or any other programming whatsoever.  Like I said the  one I had prior to this would never pick up the channels. I had a question when trying to see channels and I emailed tech-support and immediately got a satisfactory answer which allowed me to fix my app TV to receive all channels. Again I love the product and I recommend it to anybody that needs antenna. Like I say the one I had prior to this would never pick up the channels.Thanks Claude Poppenheimer.

This product works perfectly and is going to save us a pile off money from outrageous cable bills being eliminated.  Goodbye cable and hello savings!  I installed this in a few minutes and put it in in area where there is no access to other service. We are able to get 18 different channels to view. A few are not clear but not a big deal. Plenty of others that we normal would watch are. So happy we purchased this that we are getting some for our family to try.

I like this HD antenna.  I am impressed with the range and clarity of the channels received.  Before using this antenna, I received two channels (from a different brand of antenna).  After installing this antenna, I receive 20 channels.  I selected the long range on the amplifier and it helps with the amount of channels that are received.  I definitely recommend this product.

I am so disappointed! At the very beginning the antena seemed to work fine but after a month of using it the images freeze in and off  and we lose every information of the show we are watching. We thought that happened only when it was windy outside which happens non stop but even when there is no wind the reception is awful. We don’t enjoy our Spanish novelas anymore because of the bad reception.

My mom decided she couldn't afford her satellite service after another annual increase and asked me to look into an antenna for her as she just wanted to be able to keep her local news channels. After reading all the reviews, I chose this antenna.  The package included all the items needed for a quick and easy install.  I was able to get it working within five minutes and found 100+ digital channels in the metropolitan area. She even discovered channels in her native language that she was never able to get with her previous package. Highly recommend if you are looking for something that is affordable, lightweight and a no brainer to install!

This antenna should be everyone’s go to answer for HDTV channels without having to pay the big cable companies your entire paycheck!Last night there was a storm and all 3 of my family members texted me that their cable went out, meanwhile I was watching tv without any issues as my antenna didn’t respond to the nasty weather!

I'm very happy with my new HDTV antenna. We realized we only ever watched network TV and streaming services, so we decided to cut the cable cord.I had no idea we could get so many channels in our area. We get about 20 channels with strong signals. Some of them are pretty interesting, with channels devoted to sitcoms, westerns, old game shows, nostalgia TV, etc. And all the main networks have really strong signals that look better than they ever did with cable. There's still plenty of options if we want to lazily flip through channels on a Sunday afternoon.

I recently purchase this Ultra-Thin HDTV Antenna after a problem with my cable signal. I have installed it and found both the installation and use very easy. The directions are clear and simple and the components are of good quality. I am very pleased with the TV signal reception and picture quality.  I am looking forward to cutting off my cable service and saving a lot of money each month. Thank you for providing a great product at a reasonable price.

The range was fine for my needs but there is no way this inexpensive indoor antenna would have a 120 mile range unless one live on top of a lone mountain surrounded by flat plains. I live in Illinois 5 mile from the Wisconsin border. I theoretically should receive TV from Maison WI 103 miles away. I can actually get most Milwaukee and Chicago stations but a few sometimes pixelate at times and those antennas are about 40 to 45 miles away, I live on the edge of a small ridge and I have the antenna near the ceiling of a 2nd floor room. Luckily I can orient the antenna east-west to pick up both cities. The antenna is not multidirectional. The adhesive on the mounting pads is not good. It has fallen off my wall twice in less than a week,

We just received our antenna, right on time.  My husband got it set up in minutes. The picture is clear and stable. We can only get eight channels, but we live in the boonies so we are happy to be getting anything at all Lol. It feels good to be able to watch TV for free, just like in the old days. After cutting the cord and subscribing to three streaming services, we are saving over $1200 a year. Considering the relatively low price of this antenna, the amount of money we are saving by cutting the cord, and the clear picture, I highly recommend this antenna.

Just installed my antenna ( Ultra-Thin HDTV Antenna, B07XQLW1H7) and ran "auto set-up" on my Panasonic TV.  I picked up 20 signals.  When I checked signal strength, they were ranging from 68% to 100% of possible strength.  All the stations were clear and the antenna seems to do an excellent job.As an added benefit, I was able to mount it behind a wall decoration (raisin drier).  It is completely hidden, quite a change from my old rabbit ears.
I recently installed my HDTV Antenna from Gesobyte.  I plugged it intomy LG Smart TV and it immediately picked up all the local channels I

My RCA which is 6 years old gives me way more channels. I'm not one to return. I saw the ratings and thought I'd give it a shot.  Honestly, save your money and don't bother.  It's definitely not 120 miles.  My RCA is 90 miles with double the channels.

I have to admit I was skeptical about purchasing this antenna since I had bad experiences with past booster antennas. But I read some of the reviews and decided to try it. I'm glad I did because I was able to capture 47 channels during the first scan and a few more during the second and third scans. The HD channels are amazingly clear, better than cable. I live in an enclosed apartment complex with several 5-6 floor buildings knit close together. I wasn't expecting much because there were so many building and tree obstructions. After each scan, I said WOW not bad at all! I'm going to refer you guys to my friends. Thank you for making a good product!

The u must have digital antenna was a snap to install. I just hook one cable end to the tv cable in, the other cable side with the USB port. I hook the cable to the antenna and the other wire which is one the same side to a USB port in the tv. ( this power the antenna. Everything worked great. I pLace the antenna where I wanted it and then I did a auto tune on the tv. I got channels I didn’t have before.I would recommend this to anyone.Thanks Tim G

Just passing along a big thank you. I cut the cord on cable many months ago and during these crazy times with the virus I wanted access to local news. I ordered the antenna and it arrived within a couple of days. I simply plugged it in and found a good place for it to get a signal and it worked like a charm.I was impressed that from box to hooking it up to watching new local channels, took less than 15 minutes.

I purchased this antenna on April 2, 2020 from Amazon.com and installed it when it was delivered on April 5.  Installation was very simple, took only 2 minutes.  In my case, the supplied amplifier was required for reception, may be because of distance between our home and transmission towers or other interference.  However, after using the amplifier, I am receiving all the local over-the-air free channels very clearly.  I installed this antenna because I wanted to have ability to get news and other shows when our streaming service on internet is disrupted for any reason.  Also, I am sure it will be helpful to receive detailed local news during hurricanes.  BTW, the antenna is black on one side and white on the other, which helps it blend with the wall color or other items around it.  It is a great investment for a small price.Disclosure: I am submitting this review of my own free will, but also for an incentive.

I purchased this antenna thinking it was an upgrade from my 50-60 mile range leaf antenna. I was hoping to get FOX Sports (NFL games) from the neighboring state just over the 100-mile mark. Nope. I get the same channels I had with my 50-60 mile antenna. I think the manufacturer should be called out for this. There are clearly enough complaints about their range. Interestingly enough, on the actual packaging they don't specify the range at all; no bold, triple digit mileage claims in sight!If I didn't already own a leaf *and* all the stations I wanted were within 50 miles, I'd say this a fine antenna to start with; I'd probably give it 4 stars. But I would still dock it 1 star because their coaxial cable is built into the leaf which limits your distance to 4-6 feet (I'm not sure how long that cable is). My older leaf has a 'female' coax connection at the bottom of the leaf. From there I can attach my long coaxial cable. (Unfortunately, my HDTV resides on the opposite side of the house from all the TV signals.) With this newer one, I have to use a female-to-female cable joiner to extend my coax run.  It's always best to having fewer breaks in a cable run. Plus, I am suspicious of the thinness of this coax cable that hangs off the leaf.  I question if it has enough shielding.  Usually coaxial cable is thick and miserably stiff, but maybe coax cabling has changed/improved in the last 10 years or so.

I have Dish network and recently ABC pulled their channel over a dispute for more money so I decided I needed to try an antenna to get their broadcast. I found this antenna and am so happy I did. It was super easy to connect and my TV found 99 channels when going through the scan - yeah I said 99 channels. I live in metro Phoenix area which is really spread out and am far away from the towers. I tried a digital TV antenna a few years back and it was frustrating because what channels it did find, just pixellated all day long and it didn't even pick up all the main ones. This one does. I actually plan on picking up a couple more. I already called Dish and am cancelling my service. This antenna is awesome!!!

Today I received the HDTV Antenna . Everything required was included in the Package . The Instructions were Clear and simple . I plugged everything in , Turned the TV on, scanned for Available Local Channels . The HDTV Antenna found 33 Free Local Channels . The Picture Quality on my OLED TV is perfect. So is the Sound . I plan to purchase more for my other TV's .. Excellent Product . Wished I had done this Years ago .

The install of the antenna was simple and straight forward.  I was surprised to find it very thin and flexible.  That however did not keep it from getting a strong signal.  In fact I found the lightness of the antenna to be an advantage when mounting it.  I actually taped it to the wall directly behind the TV.  I tested it with and without plugging in the signal booster.  In my case I am about 20-40 miles from the TV tower depending on the station.  I found even I could get a decent signal without the booster, but powering it up gave an even better one.

Not as advertised. I live less than 15 miles from every major TV network in the city, and doesn't even pick up the signal for ABC. 98 percent of the channels are in 480i. I don't have any obstacles that could block the signal; therefore, it is a waste of money. I tried on both of my two 65" TVs, but it didn't work. I have a streaming service, but I just wanted have an antenna just in case the internet would go out.

Fantastic antenna!! I gave up cable and went without TV completely for about 8 months. I simply couldn't justify spending $150/month. However I missed having the ability to watch both national and local news. So I went online and I purchased this ultra-thin HDTV 2019 antenna with the 120 mile range. I get over 70 channels without the amplifier. I live on the north side of Dallas, Texas.I simply have it resting on the top of my entertainment center. I didn’t even need to secure it to a window or wall. It’s that powerful.

I live near Chicago and after doing the channel search I was surprised to see nearly 70 channels! This little antenna works great. I just have to say pay attention to the instructions. Since you can't really adjust the antenna, i.e. moving the wands around, you can only move it to a new spot for a better signal. The instructions say to place the antenna in a window. I would like to add, make sure the window faces the direction of the broadcast tower. In my living room, the only window faces to the south, Chicago is to the east. A good portion of the channels came in fine in the southern window, but a lot of them don't come in the best. I put the the antenna in a bedroom that has a window that faces to the east and every channel comes in clear as a bell. I would say if you are looking for a simple, relativity cheap antenna, that you know you have a good spot for, this work great.

I’m receiving twenty two channels on an ancient flat screen television. With the amplifier attached and with the unit set up in a window,I’m able to get the local CBS, Fox, and ABC affiliates broadcasting from Jacksonville, FL.  My locality is about about a thirty minute drive from the city.

We recently decided to "cut the cord" and use a streaming services. We also decided to purchase this HDTV antenna for a tv without a streaming device connected. We are so happy with this purchase. To my amazement over 29 channels are coming through and most are crystal clear. One would never know that the channels are not coming through a streaming service or cable. Set up was very easy (less than 10 min) and we love the slim profile.  You can't see the antenna. We placed on top of a curio cabinet next to the tv. It is so slim you can't see it up there and the wires are long enough to run behind the curio and up to the top. Great product and have recommended to friends.

So we lost our free cable we have had for the last 4 years, and are really unwilling to pay a ton to Xfinity/Frontier/direct TV and so on. Even though it has been well reviewed I wasn't sure if it would work right here in the pacific Northwest. Install, probably took me longer to unbox it and read the directions as it did to install it.Ran the channel search, wonderful results, locals, CBS news, and it integrated with the TV1 program that came with our Samsung HDTV. One time, $30.00, take that cable guys!

I tried this with and without the amplifier and there are zero channels coming in at all. I feel like I got scammed because of all these great reviews that claim this thing works like a charm. Its not like I'm in a rural area either, I would expect to get something at least.

Last week we decided enough is enough with the cable company that provides us television. Every year the prices just keep going up! I have to be honest though, I was a little scared and hesitant because I didnt know what to expect getting TV over the air, but at this point I was just fed up with cable. So yes, we pulled the plug and added this digital tv antenna and I couldnt be happier! I wish I would have done this years ago!. Quality is 4K HD and I get my local channels and was even able to watch monday night football. The antenna works amazing, just do your due diligence and research your local towers. We are subscribed to Amazon plus, Disney+, and Netflix.

Pretty big, about the size of a sheet of paper. Super easy to put together and install. Easy instructions. Took me less than 10 min to do it. Went from 42 channels to 261 channels. My hubby got ESPN so he’s happy. I got HSN so I’M happy! Used it for my 65” TV and bought another for my 40” TV, works awesome on both. Came fast (4days) despite this pandemic. I’m satisfied. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

So far this antenna has given me 6 channels of old sitcoms. Those streamed fairly well and I had an easy time installing this antenna. However, if I can't get any additional channels to load, I'll probably just return this antenna.It is well made and shipped quickly.  I'm not sure that this will end up suiting my needs, and I live in a suburban area about 15 miles west of Chicago. I would expect this antenna to perform better than it has so fair. However, the product seems well made and the value for the money is good.

Just purchased the U Must Have Amplified Indoor HDTV Antenna to replace the Leaf that we were using.  The installation was very easy - love that this comes with an amplifier.  Having the amplifier allowed us to receive more channels.  The picture is very clear and we no longer have to get up to move the antenna to stop static.  Am sure we will be replacing our other Leaf antennas after trying this one for a while.  Well worth it!!!

We wanted to add another TV to our home. Our cable company wanted to charge us $6.99 a month for a regular box an $9.99 for an HD box.  Our main concern was to be able to watch Jazz basketball Real soccer, both local channels. When we installed the antenna we were amazed at the quality of the picture and the amount of other channels we were able to pickup. We moved the antenna around the room several times until we got the best reception. The antenna will pay for itself in less than 3 months.
I purchased one of your Amplified HDTV Antennas off Amazon last week.It arrived the next day and was instantly installed in my living room.

My wife and I wanted a TV in the kitchen and we both decided it would be good for the kids as well. The kids would always bring their foods into the living room and would make a mess. So we decided a 43" Samsung TV would be good. We wall mounted the TV but I couldn't get any local channels to work without an antenna. I decided to look on Amazon and searched for a "TV antenna". So I looked at the "Best Sellers" section and I was wowed with over 12,000 plus the number of reviews. I made no hesitation on waiting and purchased one. Two days later the antenna arrived at the house. I took it out the box and loved how thin it was. It was perfect for me to mount onto the back of my TV. After hooking it up, I did a channel scan and 40 plus HDTV stations popped up. That means I received every digital station over the course of 50 pulse miles I would say. It's been over a week now and it never disappointed me with weak signals. I would definitely purchase more to replace all my other antennas in the house.

The advertising is misleading. Claims of ability to pull in signals from 120 miles away are super best scenario only. According to tower locator web site we are 18 miles from most broadcast towers. Our TV is next to an exterior wall on the wrong side of the house. In order to pull in signals we had to run a cable from the TV to an window on the opposite side of the house. Even then about half of the signals are strong enough for viewing while the remaining 50% fade in and out even with the included amplifier connected and powered up. A more honest description of this product should be on Amazon's web site. Let the buyer beware if you purchase one of these. It might work or it might not depending on all your variables.

Received the Digital HDTV Antenna today and hooked it up to my Samsung TV. Good and clear instructions and everything worked from the start. I plugged it into the Antenna In inlet (I have cable but the box is connected to one of the HDMI connectors). I live in the Washington DC area and got 36 channels with good quality. That included the main networks, two three PBS channels, one movie channel and a number of TV shows and shopping ones. I also tried to attach the amplifier but then I only got 20 channels and the quality was worse.I am very happy with the purchase. The instructions and set up were good and the result too. I will keep cable, at least for now, but the channels now available by air is a good complement and also a good insurance if and when the cable service is down. Having both PBS and the major networks by air is good in case of an emergency. I would certainly recommend this product.

I had my doubts about the antenna working in our area as it claims.  I have ordered others in the past and didn’t have much luck but was wanting to cut the cable.  I have Hulu, but it is still nice to be able to watch local tv for the news or if I just want to watch a local program.  To my surprise every channel cam in and I enjoy watching regular tv.  It has been so great that I have also let my parents know because they also live in a remote location and do not pay for cable, but have seen a deterioration of the channels quality over the last few years with the updated technology.  There’s also works great and they didn’t have to hire someone to come out and install an updated outdoor antenna and it sits easily without notice so they can watch there tv.  It has been so popular they have ordered one for their lake home for those rainy days when they cannot be outside.

My mother lives in a rural area and the cable and internet have been out since Hurricane Laura. I bought her this GESOBYTE HD amplified antenna so she could see some local news and television. It was very easy to set up. I was shocked at the number of channels we received and their quality! I was expecting maybe 5-6 channels for the area we live in but we get 15 channels and all of them are crystal clear!! We get a better picture quality with this antenna than we ever did with cable! Best money I’ve spent! We may just cut the cord!

It was so easy to install.  I was going to wait for my grandson to put it together for me, but after I read the usermanual I knew I was good to go.  I have a perfect picture and it's not on the wall or in the window just laying

This is probably the best HD Antenna I've had over the years. I've tried so many and all of them could barely hold a signal. Not with this one, would rarely experience any chugging when watching TV. I bought this for a friend of mine that lives near Springfield, MS so I thought I would try it here in SW Florida.  I already have OTA on my roof here and get around 80+ channels.  I was just curious as to if this would work as advertised.  It didn't.  I hooked it to two different TV's and when I scanned for channels it came up with zero.  Tried moving the antenna to different locations and still nothing.  My guess is that you have to live pretty close to the broadcast locations in order for this to work.  Their description is a little misleading.  So unless you live close to a big city I wouldn't give this one a try.  My friend did try it in Springfield and received around 60 channels so like I said it works fine near larger population areas.

I'm very pleased, especially for what I paid. "Installation" was easy as can be (how complex can using double sided tape and plugging it into your TV get?).
